comment: Sound quality is so subjective I want to review other aspects of the speaker and in comparison with comparably priced Anker Sound Boost. The reason is I was leaning toward the JBL Flip 4 but was researching Amazon to see if there were better options.  There were a number of reviews for Anker that rated it superior to Flip 4, some from people professing to be experts or audiophiles. I took a chance and originally purchased the Anker, returned the next day and bought the Flip 4.  I don;t profess to be either an expert or audiophile but I've bought many Wireless Speakers ranging from cheap to Beats and Bose.  When I opened the Anker I was disappointed. The USB charging cable was obviously flimsy and cheap and the documentation even cheaper appearing. I had charge issues right off the bat and tried to contact support. In the interim I learned from web research that charging issues are not uncommon and that the manufacturer recommends using a different (higher quality) charging cable as the first remedy. I also learned that the instruction manual is incorrect and that the manufacturer is familiar with both problems yet continue to ship the speakers with these two inadequate components!  I did connect the Anker to a couple of my devices and the Bluetooth connection was quick and easy. Both the range and sound quality were less than I expected. And, when I connected to my High Resolution Sony Digital player the volume control of the player was disabled.  I researched that problem and found that it is a known issue when the Sony is connected to some lower quality Bluetooth devices.The JBL Flip 4 arrived professionally packaged (as expected) with a robust USB charging cable and separately packaged, professionally printed and ACCURATE instructions.  Initial charge was quick and as documented. Bluetooth connection is also quick and easy.  Range is probably at least as good as advertised and way better than the Anker. All controls of my connected devices (i.e. Sony player volume, etc.) work perfectly. Sound quality is subjective but that along with volume, bass, etc. it certainly meets my expectations and certainly is superior to Anker Sound Boost.  JBL and Harman Kardon are brands that music lovers know they can trust and they continue to deliver.  This is probably the best Bluetooth Speaker you can buy for under $100.  I only share this in case someone else is considering the Flip 4 and checking out the options.  Please don't get fooled by reviews of some competitors, especially those who use JBL Flip 4 in unfavorable comparison. Of course we all buy speakers for the sound not for the packaging or accessories or printed material but if those things are inferior it's pretty indicative of what to expect with the main product.

I bought this speaker August 4th of 2017. It sounded great when working, but a week ago it stopped taking a charge. I have tried all kinds of things, and tested all the possible USB chargers to make sure that it was not the chargers. The unit just does not charge at all, I have tried overnight charging, and 2 days worth or USB, and a different cable,  but no go. My next step is to see if JBL will honor some kind of warranty. Booo!

This is a bittersweet review: I purchased this speaker in June of 2017, and for 14 months, this has been an outstanding little speaker. Sound is crisp, rich and bold. It is indeed water resistant and has held up under many different conditions, including the Florida heat and inclement weather. I don't know if I used it a bit more than the average consumer (20 to 30 hours a week), but in the past 30 days, I've noticed the battery life diminishing exponentially. Today (after a full charge last night), the battery was completely drained after 2 hours of use. The only other complaint I had prior to this, is that the charging cable broke at about the 9 month mark. So in summation, it may be that I just used it to "death", however for the $90+ paid for the device, I am very disappointed to not experience much greater longevity.

I will be writing this view with a total and complete comparison to a $25 Anker speaker I previously purchased.  The JBL beats the Anker in the most important category.  It does sound better.  However, with a much steeper price tag, it better.The Anker is far superior in the other two categories.  I beat the hell out of my Anker and even got it soaked in water only for it to keep on ticking.  Supremely impressed.  The JBL already has a tear in the mesh speaker portion.  It has not been quite as road tested but I'm not very optimistic.
I am so fascinated how extremely great this speaker is for only a whopping 100$ dollars. I would buy this speaker for 300$. An absolute steal!Pros:

It is very sad, my JBL Flip 4 just stopped working, it doesn't charge anymore. It has been less then a year since i used it. It has been handled with care. I'm not sure what to do now. The JBL it self worked really good, I really liked the sound. I really don't recommend it to anyone. My JBL Flip 4 is still under warranty but I can't get hold of anyone to see what action i need to take next. I googled it and apparently it is know problem by JBL at some point they just stop working....... Very sad for the price that it is. ....... Many people have similar issues with it. They say that to fix it you need to take it apart and reconnect or do something of that sorts. If you want to go through that go ahead a buy it!!! I regret spending so much money and not get use of it.

This speaker is absolutely amazing, and definitely worth the price! I have been using this speaker ever since I received it in the mail. I was so impressed with the quality, the sound, and the bass. I bought the white speaker, and the only thing I have to say about it is that the color looks like more of a pure white when it is in the light and might look like more of an off-white/grey in regular light. The speaker came with a wrist strap which is really awesome, and also a charger. The packaging is very nice, and I am going to use that as a place to put my JBL when I finish using it. It is very easy to pair with a device, and if you choose to download the JBL Connect+ app it is also easy to pair with as well. The battery life is spectacular, so you don't really have to worry about charging it often. Overall, great speaker! I would recommend this to anyone!

Ok, if you are reading the reviews, you know by now that the battery life is horrible. And here is another review about it.The sound is amazing. When you first start using it, you are really impressed by everything about the Flip 4. After 1 year using it, battery won't charge at all. I started using it connected to the power. And now, not even that will work. For a brand like JBL, it seems to me that they don't care about it. So many people with the same problem, and I couldn't find any answer from JBL.

This speaker died six months after purchase.  It was used a limited amount of time and was never exposed to water.  It just stopped working. The enclosed documentation is printed in hundreds of languages, but no where can I locate warranty information. A most unsatisfactory buying experience.

The only reason I am giving this product two stars instead of one star is because when it worked, it had excellent sound.  HOWEVER, after a year of minimal use, it will not accept a charge anymore.  It has not been dropped or abused in any way.  I would expect a speaker that cost $100 or so to last MUCH longer.  Very disappointed.  Will not be buying a JBL product again.

Nice, crisp, clean sound. I do not agree with some reviewers who complain that there's not enough bass. My complaint is that most headphones and speakers these days have too much. I listen mostly to jazz and classical, and I want a balanced sound with good mid-range and highs. I am frequently finding too much bass even with 'bass reducer' on.  Custom equalization in the speakers and headphones themselves are probably the only way to satisfy everyone.  I like the sound of this however.I dropped a star for this reason: there is no way to skip back a song and that is really annoying. Every other speaker/headphone/earbud I own has a way to skip backwards -- this is the first device without that ability and they need to fix that. I'm also not wild about all the loud, weird noises it makes going on and off -- like a spaceship taking off and landing. They should offer a way to disable that.

Great little speaker but unfortunately JBL is switching away from connect+ (which this and most others have from JBL) to "Party boost" for connecting more than one speaker around the house or yard at the same time. JBL is making ALL their speakers obsolete with pairing to newer speakers. The flip 5 is only the current model that has jumped to part boost so far. The software is not fwd or backwards compatible so either stick with the older models or buy the newest ones..which haven't all come out yet. Really a let down. Terrible decision to not make them all talk together.

Has GREAT sound production. And range is decent at about 100 feet. The issue with this unit is its performance. It doesn't have an adequate play time from a full charge. If you're looking for a quiet relaxing experience listening to your favorite classical music, at low tone, then it may impress you with stamina. But, for the rest of us who are looking to jam the set with some deep beat grooves of R & B, some ambient progressive House/Trance music, then 3/3.5 hours @ 0.75 volumes is the maximum time for snapping your fingers, nodding your head and swaying your hips.I have purchased other units in the past that have an even greater dynamic sound and performed for longer at higher levels of sound then this unit, go figure ü§î.

Battery: The battery life seems good. It lasts long enough to not pay attention to how long it lasts honestly.Sound: It is very good, very clear until 80% volume, then it gets a bit distorted. However, I never use it more than 60% volume anyways since it gets really loud. I think, if you need a product to play music in a very large and crowded party, just get a bigger speaker. For all the other use cases, this is just good enough. Another thing to mention is the bass is boosted, sometimes it fells like too much to me. But, I know some will love it this way.

I purchased two of these speakers in November 2017. It seemed a very promising product. It provides relatively decent sound, and can be connected to a number of devices. However, after just a little over a year of having purchased two of these and making moderate to light use of them, BOTH have stopped working: There seems to be some kind of battery flaw--the speakers will work for a few minutes, and then a crackling noise will begin, after which the speakers simply turn themselves off. I had extensive correspondence with customer service, and they are not only unable and/or unwilling to help, but seem unable and/or unwilling to even understand what the problem is. Most of the time, it feels like I am corresponding with a computer rather than a human being.I will have to purchase new speakers. They will most definitely NOT be JBL at this point, and I would caution anybody from buying these--certainly if you are interested in a speaker that will last for more than one year.
I've had these for about 2 1/2 months....and all I can say is....Wow!! These are so much better than I expected!I bought 2 for stereo sound and they are astounding! I love them!!

I purchased this speaker in April of 2019.  I upgraded from a 30 dollar blue tooth speaker my doss sound box which was 3 years old at the time wasn't holding a charge so i figured well maybe if i spend another 50 dollars i will get quality.  JBL.  Good name.  I've seen and heard their speakers before.  It is July of 2020 and the speaker is isn't holding a charge and dying often.  I am very vexed as I feel like i have not received my money's worth because I have a 30 dollar speaker which STILL WORKS 4 years later.  4 years later that one works that i paid 30 for. this one that i paid 80?  nope.  No dice.I used to be able to run it for 3-4 hours at a clip on full charge.  Now i don't even get that out of it i get maybe an hour if i am lucky and that isn't at full blast volume.

I've experienced the sound of a flip 3 and for the life of me, I can't figure out why the 4 would lack so much bass.  Not my biggest gripe. Bluetooth was terrible. I had to re-pair it with every device I used it on, every. single.time..  Bluetooth is awesome when it works but it is one of the most finicky wireless standards out there.  Sadly my experience sucked. Probably a bad chip.  Crappy bluetooth sealed the deal, though as I was already unhappy with the bass response.  I feel they may have cut some corners in the design.  Had to return, not interested in another.  I appreciate the other reviews offering some competing products.

I have owned this speaker, purchased on Amazon, for 2 years now, and as of last month, it will no longer hold a charge.  The battery life used to be excellent, I would rarely have to charge it with moderate use.  Now the speaker will only work if I keep it plugged in, very inconvenient, and even then, sometimes the speaker will start crackling and then randomly shut off.  If I turn it back on, it will work again.  I purchased this speaker over other brands as I have always had great luck with JBL and was a believer in their products so I paid the price premium for it.  Reading some other reviews, this seems to be a relatively common problem, which is completely unacceptable for something as simple as this.  I have other battery operated electronics that I have owned for 5, 10 years, etc that still work perfect.  NO EXCUSE FOR THIS JBL!!!  Others indicate they have called customer service to be told they are out of warranty and they won't help.  That is BS, especially given JBL should be aware that this speaker as a defect causing reduced life of the battery.  Let me also say this speaker has been babied by me.  It has never been in water, never even rained on.  It has ALWAYS been kept indoors in a climate controlled environment when not in use.  Very upset about this.  I will try contacting customer service and if they are willing to do anything, I will update my review.  As of now though, I highly DO NOT RECOMMEND this product.

I bought a flip4 in May 18, I bought another in Jun 18.  They have decent sound.  The first unit bought in May died in Jun 19, now the second new unit I purchased in Jun 18 is doing the same thing a month later.  It won't hold a charge sometimes and it when it does it takes about 5 hrs to recharge this is exactly like the first one did before it totally failed.Both flip4's have never been abused or even wet. I believe it is the circuit board that is cheap and defective but the battery is marginal in these things too.

I've got three of these. They can all be connected together to give a surround sound experience and they work best indoors, but actually carry well outdoors as well. A drawback to connecting the devices is range. Unfortunately, the range on these isn't really that great. So, for outdoor uses, it can be annoying when one speaker moves too far away and you have to reconnect manually if it's separated for too long. Indoors, you have to worry about walls and things that mess with signal strength. Even a single, hollow, basic door can interrupt the signal if you move more than 10 feet away from the signal transmitter.I particularly love the water resistance on these bad boys because I take mine kayaking all the time. I have, in fact, tested the submersibility of these and, although not recommended, they will not be harmed if only underwater for a few seconds. So, definitely don't worry if it starts raining, but it's still best to give them a little refuge from the constant barrage of water. Spalshing is fine, even mud is OK (again, not recommended...but it won;t break the thing) and you can wash it off if it gets dirty...Just don't go overboard- it's still a speaker.

I had a JBL Flip 2 and loved it, so I bought a JBL Flip 3 and also loved it! I also have friends who own the JBL Charge and the JBL Pulse, and I've always been impressed by those models as well. So, when the JBL Flip 4 came out, and I saw its price is so affordable, I went ahead and bought it because it never hurts to have a few (one in my office, one in the RV, one in the living room, etc).I bought the Ocean Blue color, which I was impressed with as soon as I opened it. The color is beautiful; dark, deep, and unassuming, but also different and unique. I really love the color. My first impression was that the Flip 4 felt heavier than my Flip 3, and I was excited to hear the quality of the sound, because I was sure JBL was continuing to innovate and improve their flagship bluetooth speaker...

I loved the sound on this speaker. Around 1 year, 3 months, it stopped charging. Bummer.Update 10/1/2019: I contacted JBL customer service and as this failure occurred at 1.25 years, I have exceeded the 1 year warranty and they will not do anything about it. They suggested I could take it to a repair shop and pay for those expenses, if I can find a shop that is qualified. I'm not sure the battery can actually be replaced. I effectively purchased an $86, disposable speaker. The speaker won't work if it is plugged in and the battery won't work. I purchased this because of the reputation JBL has for quality, but I am disappointed with the disposable nature of this product. It looks like there are other reviewers with the same issue.

I purchased mine Saturday night and had it in hand Monday morning, (I kind of cheated. I work for the USPS, so I was able to intercept mine before it went out for delivery) so huge props for rapid shipping. As I mentioned, I work for the USPS as a mail carrier, and I wanted a decent speaker to listen to music and audiobooks while delivering my route. Mail trucks are not at all quiet inside. Road noise is horrible and the bumps and bangs of the suspension are quite loud. The engines engines typically sound like someone dumped a box of ball bearings into an old blender. All in all, not a very listener-friendly environment. Regardless, this relatively small speaker (roughly the size of a 16-18 ounce soda can) powers through the ambient noise and is clear and loud. Very solid bass for such a small platform. I started my route of about 5.75 hours of road time, fully charged, and at the end of the day, it was at about 80% charge.I love this thing. It even fits in my drink holder in the truck.

I bought this speaker about a year and nine months ago after returning one of the same model because I thought it was defective. It had terrible Bluetooth connectivity; it was unable to keep a solid connection more than about 20 feet from the source.This one--the replacement--was a little better but still not impressive in that regard. Still, satisfied that it wasn't so much a defective product as a design issue, I decided to live with it. The sound was good, and the battery life seemed pretty good too. I was happy enough with this for a few months. Then the battery life started plummeting.

It doesn't charge anymore, it was good for a couple months after I bought it. I used to play music in my room when I was on my a cruise.  Then didn't use it again for a while till today (july 1st). It died and now it's not chargin at all, I know the charger and cord work because I charge my headphones from it. It's even the cord that came with the speaker. NOT happy with it

So when i first bought this speaker just over a year ago I was stoked about it! It was loud, had great battery life, and decent sound quality for the price. Now just over a year later, I cannot get the speaker to stay on for 5 mins playing music no matter how full the battery is. It plays for a few mins then starts crackling the bass/speakers really bad and then shuts off. Even if it when i leave it plugged in it only plays for 30mins or so before doing the same weird speaker crackling and shut off. I get that this wasn't super top of the line but i most deff thought I'd get more than a year out of the speaker! I'll be shopping elsewhere for my Bluetooth speaker needs....

These are great. I was using the JBL for quite some time and I never complained from them, until the unfortunate event where my nephew dropped them on the floor and the bass was busted. I went on to buy the FLIP 4  and the sound is noticeably better along with the quality and the great waterproof features ( which i don't really intend to risk using in the water, but it's good to know it's there)the only thing that bugged me is that the FLIP had a cover along with a charger, which was a cool feature. the FLIP 4 on the other hand, come with a charging cable only.

I bought this Flip 4 to replace an aging Aomais Sport II that was now giving me 2 hours of playtime and the last hour was fuzzy noise.The size of the JBL Flip 4 threw me it‚Äôs tiny fits in my hand. The sound threw me next. It‚Äôs a very nice sounding product for what you get. My yard is pretty big, with a running waterfall at the poolside. I wanted a device that could fill pool area with music. The JBL Flip 4 handles that. Better than my last two devices.

Let me first say, this is my second JBL flip 4, the one I had prior to this was an absolute BRUTE. I‚Äôm talking tough! It had been submerged under water, dropped countless times, taken to the beach, withstanded super hot summer days for hours, getting caked with mud but alas, it got ran over by a car while off-roading one day... but guess what? It STILL WORKS. Even in its smashed up state nothing broke but the speaker cover protector. So bravo JBL, this is a great product. However I bought this one for my father for his birthday, he only used it a few times in his bedroom and now it won‚Äôt turn on at all, so I tinkered with it come to find out it was a remanufactured speaker put back together incorrect without water proof rubber gaskets for the speakers, keep in mind I payed full price for a NEW speaker! Now the return windows are closed and I‚Äôm unsure who to contact to hopefully make this right...

Update: I can now say without a doubt that the sound quality on the flip4 is superior to the UE Boom speakers. I was at my sisters house and she had the UE Boom going and all I could think is 'Where is the base?' On the flip 4 the base is rich and strong. I am so glad I have the flip 4 now. I almost bought the other.This is the second JBL flip 4 I have owned. The first one was great but the battery would no longer hold a charge after only 1.5 years of what I thought was mild usage. I broke it because I tried to replace the battery. These speakers are not built to have a battery replacement. ANYWAY , I bought it again because after suffering over the last 2 months with an Anker bt speaker that cost about 30 bucks I wanted my flip 4 back. I missed the beautiful base and over all sound quality. The speaker arrived in the mail today and I'm in heaven. All my favourite songs on pandora have come back to life because of it! The short overall battery life sucks but the sound on this speaker is what makes this second purchase the right choice. My sister has these huge UE bt speakers and I swear i like the flip 4 more than i like them. I think the base is more impressive but then, that's me.  By the way these are made  by Harmon Kardon. Thanks for reading.
I went and compared 3 similar portable speakers with each other (same price of around $100 each):JBL Flip 4

I was in need of a new portable speaker, and like many of you, I was a little overwhelmed after doing an Amazon search and finding literally tens of thousands of options to choose from.  It's especially frustrating because probably the most important part of the product -- how good it sounds -- is not something you can really evaluate until after you physically have it.  So I picked four speakers to compare: Cambridge Soundworks OontZ Angle 3 Plus, Anker SoundCore Sport XL, Geek Beats Jolt5, and the JBL Flip 4.First, the
Really good sound - surprising bass coming from this little speaker.Edit:

Bought 2 of these, one white and one red so that we could take advantage of stereo and party modes.  In party mode they both play the same exact audio and in stereo one is left and one right ( obviously )  I do recommend getting 2 different colors, when you open the app it actually identifies the speaker and its color so setting left or right for stereo is super simple since you can see each speaker pictured with its color.  Reason I chose these JBLs is based on some reviews I have read and watched on youtube.  They are not the loudest out there but plenty loud and for me the selling point was that even at max volume the sound was crisp and didn't distort.  They are water and dust proof, I have dropped one under water already and it still works great.  We take these along when we go paddle boarding and clip them to our boards without any worries of them getting wet.  While paddling I operate my phone all via voice which works really well with this speaker.  So as far as sound goes they are great, range is great, really are waterproof and plenty loud for a party.  Reason I took away 1 star is that there is no way to go to previous track, not that I have discovered anyway, please msg me if I am wrong and I'll up the rating. The play button acts as play/pause/and with double tap next track..  Why not add a triple tap for previous? Or maybe use the Bluetooth connect button double tap for previous?  Since the speakers get software updates maybe this is something that will get implemented.  If you are wondering if the stereo and party modes and if its worth getting these for that alone I would say yes.  We used them on a houseboat in both party and stereo mode and the sound filled the entire upper deck of the 80 ft boat with no problem.

I am not rich and $80 is a pretty big investment for me to make in a speaker. I reviewed, reviewed and reviewed all these speakers for two weeks before being convinced this was "the best." And, for the first 60 or so days it was. But, out of nowhere, it has now just started turning off while playing music. Full charge, half charge, doesn't matter. It just turns itself off.Do you know how annoying it is to be listening to music and have to go up to the speaker every 10 or so minutes and turn it back on? I mean, come on, that's ridiculous, no? Read ALL the critical reviews on Amazon about this item. You will notice a trend about this sort of thing.

Before anyone assumes that I received any sort of discount, I bought this at the full price of $99.95Price - As the title indicates, in my opinion this truly is the best speaker out there that you can buy with $100. At $99.95 this speaker is very affordable, of course if you live in most states you will pay about $7 more for tax but in certain states you won't be charged any. In the box you will receive a JBL Flip 4 speaker (with a paracord loop), a JBL tangle free Micro-USB cable, Quick Start Guide, Important Safety Instructions, and a Warranty Card.

Although I'm not doing speaker reviews anymore I was so impressed by the JBL Flip 4 that I had to write a little something. The Xiaomi Mi has been my go-to BT speaker. It has really great sound; especially for the size. Sadly I accidentally played some frequency test tones at high volume and my Xiaomi Mi was blown. After 3 days of only having laptop speakers I was fed up. I needed something better. Good things have been written about the JBL Flip 3, and I always wanted to give it a try. Now the 4 is out and I hear it's even better! Being desperate for quality sound I bought one.I really wasn't planning on buying any speakers and really couldn't afford it. I'm experienced and very picky about audio. From all I've read my expectations were very high. Given all of this the odds were stacked high against the Flip 4.

I actually have an oontz speaker which I liked but they are all defective after a few months where the charging ports stop working. I got a replacement which also broke so I tried this speaker. First I really don‚Äôt like that you can‚Äôt see the battery percent on this JBL speaker. There‚Äôs a area that has 4 lights that lights up when you turn the speaker on. This shows you the battery percent but only when you turn the speaker on. So if you‚Äôre playing the speaker for hours you won‚Äôt know the battery percent unless you turn speaker off then on. On the oontz you can look on your iPhone and see battery percentage and it also has the little earphone on the top of phone showing that it‚Äôs connected to your speaker. On the jbl nothing will show on your phone that you‚Äôre connected to the speaker. Also I like use the Bluetooth to listen to a audio book as I go to sleep. I like the volume low on my speaker while having the volume for iPhone alarm loud so I can wake up on time. With the jbl speaker the volume for everything on your phone is connected to the speaker. So if you have the speaker volume low that means your phone alarm and ringer is the same volume. I‚Äôve gone into my iPhone to see if there was something that could be done but my settings on sound: change volume with buttons was off. Meaning that anything connected should not affect my phone volume settings. So this speaker is really not user friendly. I‚Äôm returning this and trying a more expensive oontz with a 2 year protection plan. Fingers crossed.

I decided to order the Certified Refurbished for 69.00 from RARTV.  I've always ordered refurbished electronics and had good luck.  This item is absolutely perfect.  Don't let the "plain box" thing stray you.  It's still very clearly custom made to fit the speaker perfectly,  it has cardboard holders on each end keeping the speaker suspended in the middle.  And a JBL sticker that fit's over the top of the box, not just a sticker pasted on, it's tailored to the box.  So you if don't care about the blah blah on-boxing and packaging, you get what you need.  The speaker doesn't have a mark on it and I wouldn't believe that it's not new, just repackaged due to a return our something.  That being said, I'm a child of the 80's where we had 5' tall speakers and massive amps.  I'm constantly amazed at how far things have come.  For it's size I'm astonished how well it sounds.  If you stick it in the corner of you counter top while cooking you'll get much more bass giving it corners to bounce off.  In a complete open area, the bass is surprisingly strong, but I would say it's highlights would be vocals, and clarity of all the stuff above the deep bass.  I can say this is for, the money, this is the most satisfying electronic's purchase I've made for a long time.  As soon as I heard it I immediately started thinking of more and more places I could bring good sounding music with me.  A definite thumbs up to JBL and RARTV for giving this quality for the money.

Used this speaker for about 1 1/2 to 2 weeks. Bought it for use at work. After first use (a little over 3 hrs) I saw that the red LED was blinking. Low battery. I thought it was odd since they advertise a 12 hour battery life. But figured, maybe I didn't charge it all the way. Decided to do some tests.Recharged it (5 steady white LEDs that then turn off when complete). Tests were using Bluetooth connection within 10 feet.
Really want to Return this speaker no way to contact seller on this defective speaker need to return

Great sound.  Great appearance. Great packaging.  HOWEVER, the battery couldn't be any worse.  Co-workers own the Flip2 and Flip3, and all of is have experienced the same. After only a few uses the battery no longer holds a charge and ois nearly impossible to get a full charge.  If JBL can't get this issue fixed and stand behind their product,  I think you should look elsewhere for a speaker.

And... we're back.  They actually replaced the darn thing after a few emails back and forth, including sending me return shipment authorization.  As before, this speaker sounds great.  Service was satisfactory and the replacement arrived in good time.*****

This is slightly bigger than the Flip 3 (which I just returned due to a loose screw or something inside). I decided to upgrade for about $7 to the Flip 4. Love the sound of the Flip 4 (and Flip 3), the battery is a bit better than the Flip 3 and I am glad it is fully waterproof where the Flip 3 was splash proof.Solved Added a Star - Latest Firmware Update resolved the noisy on and off sounds that we have been complaining about for more than a few years. Worth mentioning is that if you play this bad boy at a high vol. level the battery power does drop accordingly. As much as 60% (to ~4 hrs) at Hi Vol. You can play it plugged in tho so a portable bat. or outlet helps.

I've been wanting a portable speaker for a while now and finally broke down to get one before our vacation this year. After a decent amount of research, this one kept coming up in the top 3 or top 5 portable speakers on the market. And I liked it best because of it's price point.I tried it out while watching movies and listening to music, and it does a great job at both. I have not yet tried out the speakerphone or the JBL Connect app, but I didn't get it for a speakerphone and I'm not planning on getting another one so no need for the app to link others for "party mode".

I initially tried to save some money and bought an Oontz (forget which model, it was about half the price, though, so this might not be comparing apples to apples) triangle-shaped speaker. It arrived, and honestly it sounded so horrible I assumed it must be defective and returned it.  I'm not really a sound snob, but that speaker sounded awful. Everything was distorted and mushy, even at medium volumes.So, after reading that basically everybody thought the JBL speakers sounded better, I decided to order this one. So far, I'm super happy.  What sounded distorted and mushy on the Oontz sounds clear and warm on the JBL, even at louder volumes. The JBL does sound the tiniest bit tinny or hollow, but that is just me being critical, it doesn't bother me at all.  Honestly I was surprised at how good the speaker sounded.

Great speaker for both indoor and outdoor use. I use it as a speaker for my projector, for music streaming in the apartment, for beach entertainment, and backyard bbqs.I would give it 5 stars, but Ive had some issues with the usb charging port on the speaker. The last speaker I had, the charging port malfunctioned. No bends, not breaks, just stopped charging. Apparently other people had some issues with this as well. Ive learned to be much more careful when plugging in, but is still something I worry about.

PROSBIG SOUND: This little gizmo gives clean, clear sound across the entire frequency range, including plenty of bass. If you need volume, it will give you quite a bit, and if you run several together (see the JBL web site for specs and capabilities), you could greatly increase the coverage area. Several of these might make an excellent compact wireless speaker system, as long as you start with fully charged batteries and remember the power limitations of each unit - 16 watts (8 X 2) maximum.

My Flip 3's battery decided to visit Valhalla recently, and after a botched attempt at repairing that old workhorse failed (I accidentally sliced through the ribbon cable, oopsie!) I had to look for a replacement unit.  After a lot of searching, reading both professional and amateur reviews of the seemingly hundreds of Bluetooth speakers out there, I decided it'd be best to just get the Flip 4.  So far, I have not been disappointed with my purchase.Compared to the previous model, it seems the sound quality has been slightly improved on this version.  It's notably brighter than before, and the bass is ever so slightly less lumpy sounding.  It still won't fill a room up with thunderous boomy bass, but none of the speakers in this size category will.  Like the previous version, this thing feels like it's built like a tank, and may survive a drop or five on a hard surface without totally breaking.  All the buttons have a nice, tactile feel to them so you can easily adjust the volume or hit the play-pause-skip button without looking.  The buttons for power and linking two devices together are more recessed now, and a bit harder to hit, but this makes it easier to carry around without accidentally turning it off mid-song.

It feels like it's built well and it looks great...and then I turned it on and heard the God-awful hissing. Even with no sound playing and no devices connected the hissing echo'd through my office.  Got a replacement and this one hisses when any sound is playing. Tested via AUX cable and bluetooth. Even the power up and power off sounds produce the hissing noise with no devices or charging cable connected. Sending the replacement back for a refund and moving on.

I work in a factory... It is noisy... I have tried many different music making time killer solutions over the years (yes years)... My music requirements have changed because I no longer want to share my music with my surrounding coworkers... Now a lot of them use earbud headphones and don't enjoy my old time rock and roll... My last successful attempt was the JBL Xtream speakers, very nice a bit too loud and a bit too heavy to carry in my work backpack... I tried to use my old Jawbone original and it was no way cutting it, but the size was perfect... So I thought maybe somebody has made something similar size and more powerful... I already liked JBL, so the JBL Flip 4 was something that may work... After all these years I think maybe I have found the perfect speaker... It really is very loud for its size...

I already owned one for the last year - and I love it. I wanted to put one in the larger rooms to create a fuller sound throughout the house- so I bought during cyber Monday.  Battery life isn't and issue but keeping an eye out for it is my problem.  I usually go to use and THEN discover the lack of charge.I lowered the rating of bluetooth connect as I have had difficulty that still may be operator error.  The website claims that you can connect these an unlimited amount of times - and tech sites say it's very plausible up to 7.  I now have 3 and have issues.  Inconsistent connection and clarity in certain rooms and I have questioned the battery life and considered the connection struggle the cause.

This is the 7th one of this type of speakers our family has owned...yeah don't ask. Its the second JBL, the original model very similar to this cylinder I bought at Verizon on a whim 4 years ago for about $200. This was a fantastic speaker that my son snuck off to college with him...leaving me the cheaper  Costco and box versions.Its no surprise these little speakers have put the big ole speakers on the back shelf. This JBL Flip 4 is crystal clear. I can imagine some of the gut busting bass crowd complaining it doesn't stir your meal from lunch...the kind of bass that drowns out the music. To my ear, It has plenty of bass for 70s,80s, 90s rock and classical music....and more importantly....a good clear sound.

I am a married, mother of three, who likes to ‚Äúunwind‚Äù with a few neighbors and friends occasionally. Tonight, amid the Covid-19 outbreak, The hubby and I were cooking hot wings and  feeding a few people, when we had a noise compliant. The JBL speaker that we‚Äôve owned for a few weeks has gained us a ‚ÄúNOISE‚Äù complaint. And for the record, my husband and I are the supervisors of the deputies who had to answer the callFor that noise complaint. So, with that said, I highly recommend this speaker because the last time We had a noise complaint  was when we had a live band!

What a piece of junk... it worked GREAT when it actually worked. Then 3 months into very light use, and one day it just wouldn‚Äôt charge, turn on, or respond to any button combination. It‚Äôs turned into an expensive anchor.

Love this compact little speaker. I took it with me on a 10 day trip through Columbia - through the beach, city, and forest - and it worked perfectly. I've not submerged it in water but occasionally splashing it to keep it clean hasn't impacted its quality at all. As for the Bluetooth, the range seems to hold up; I've left my connected phone upstairs and it still plays well, so that does it for me.The only thing I have no positive comments on is the speakers' long-term durability. Up until today (about a month since delivery) it worked perfectly. But now, no matter how close my computer/phone is, the Flip 4 cannot play anything without skipping the audio semi-frequently. I'm hoping the issue will simply resolve itself, but this issue leaves me skeptical about the speaker durability and forces me to leave a 3-star review instead of the 5 I want to give it.

This is a great speaker.  Sounds bigger than it is. Charges fast and lasts a long time.  Pairs easily and sounds fantastic playing everything from Classical to Country, Rock to Reggae, and Progressive to Pop.  Although it says it is waterproof, I haven't tried to test that yet!  I'm sure it would survive a light splash or maybe a sprinkle of rain, but I'm not gonna throw it in a pool anytime soon.  I love its sound and I have dog ears.  I can hear the highs balanced with the lows.  Typically a speaker this small won't have any bass, but this speaker does fine.  Can use it as a speakerphone, there's an app where you could link dozens of them to listen to a single source, which would be great in a party environment.  Overall, this was a great product and I have yet to keep it a full volume for long since it gets louder than I need. When outdoors it is easily heard within 20 feet and not overbearing or sounding overblown.  Bass doesn't tend to fuzz out on this even with battery usage towards the end of charge.  I really like this little speaker for the cost and for the performance.  I'm very satisfied with this purchase and use it several times a week.

What a great speaker!!  I've been a DJ for over 20 years and I know good sound.  Now keep in mind, Bluetooth can‚Äôt hack higher quality audio as well as wired.  So if you are listening to this speaker via Bluetooth it's going to be a lower quality sound (not the fault of the speaker).  That being said, this speaker can push the base and hit the highs better than any other speaker at this compact size.  I originally bought this for my office, but the volume is just not low enough for that environment.  I had to get a cheaper speaker.  Now I carry this one around with me on the disc golf course, garage or just working around the house.  The battery life is excellent as long as you're not playing it a peak volume.  But I can say I don't always listen to Meatloaf when I'm in the garage, but when I do so do my neighbors.

I like JBL stuff. Really. But I gave this four out of five stars for a few reasons. First of all, I'm fully aware that this is a small speaker. Most of the reviews say that this flip4 is super. I think its merely good for what it is. Overall sound quality is good, but due to the small size, there's not alot of bass. Nice weight and feel to the speaker and the materials are top notch.  The sound doesnt really distort at full volume, but theres not much difference between about 70% to 100%. A little bonus is the lanyard attached to it. I added a carabiner clip so I can carry it anywhere. The waterproof design is great and the speaker feels very durable. However, when laid flat it tends to roll. JBL should have made the ends hexagonal so that it's immobile on flat surfaces. Nice to be able to listen to other media and take calls if needed on the phone. Also, the battery life sucks. I dont get more than 4 hours of playback before having to recharge. I've never tried to connect multiple speakers using the JBL connect feature, but maybe that's what makes these popular. I bought this during black Friday, so I got a decent deal, but I would not pay full price.Update 2/14/19

Update July 11 2020I haven't even used this speaker up until recently. The battery is only lasting about 4 hrs. I bought my son one before I bought mine and his last about 12 hrs. He uses his a lot. I'm really bummed out and I paid more for mine than I did his. Bought from this same place.

I‚Äôve had my JBL speaker for about eight months now. I‚Äôm still blown away by this speaker‚Äôs ability. It sounds incredible. I‚Äôve tried many speakers in the past but none have come close to this. Before buying the JBL I had actually purchased a Beats speaker. I wasn‚Äôt sure which to go with at first and wanted to compare the Beats speakers with JBL. When I put them side by side, I could not tell any difference at first in the sound. I probably am a bit of an audiophile so I‚Äôm always looking for that clear, crisp sound. After spending some time with the speakers, I came to the conclusion that JBL sounded crisper or more pleasant to my ears. Not to confusion its loudness with its clarity I do think there is without a doubt a noticeable difference between the two. To get another opinion on the matter I asked a relative to do a blind sound test. I placed the two speakers in front of her and asked her to keep her eyes closed. She was to pick out the one that sounded more pleasant to her ears. Between each song I flipped the speakers around. I shuffled through different music genres. 3 times out of 5 she kept picking the JBL. Needless to say, the Beats speaker was quickly sent back. I‚Äôm happy with my decision. I will probably purchase more JBL speakers in the future.
I loved my JBL Flip 3 but one day it just stopped taking a charge and I knew I'd have to move on...I got this Flip 4 (camoflauge pattern) as a gift and absolutely love it.

The concept of bluetooth speaker is usually small cheap with low quality sound.  As technologies advances premium speakers now comes with solid construction, large drivers and high power amplifiers.  For those who is in the market for a cheap speaker will find hundreds to choose from.  No matter how good the reviews are for the Tribet, Oontz and UE Booms they are all run of the mill speakers that only satisfies the masses.  For high quality sound buyers usually have to step up to a higher price point.  While higher end Bose, Sony and Harmon costs over $200, half of that will get you pretty decent sounding speakers.  The Flip 4 looks great and its easy to carry, rugged and waterproof.  With 10 hours of battery life this little speaker can pump out clear highs and satisfying lows.  Voice sound natural and bass drum comes with a kick.  There are numerous placement options for the speaker and all controls are intuitive and easy to reach.  The clean upper range produced is a good sign that the component speakers are of good quality.  Driving 8 watts X 2 along with 2 side firing bass radiators the speaker has enough power to fill a medium sized room.  Like most I have been in the market for a good sounding speaker and have been disappointed time after time.  Realizing that a cheaper speaker will simply not satisfy my needs, going up in pricing to get the Flip 4 was the best decision I made.  If sound quality, portability and all-weather construction is important to you then you should spend to get this.  At $90, this little gem is better than the Bose, Harmon and Sony counterparts.

I have always been a JBL fan. I love the brand. So it's no surprise that I decided to upgrade to the Flip 4. Where to begin?First. The sound is great, for a portable speaker it really fills a room! My partner loves having it in the kitchen when he is washing the dishes, and I can hear the music through the house at a quality level (whether I want to or not ha!) I use it when I am in my studio painting, and can place it anywhere and still get great sound!

Well before I begin I will say that I had already done my research and I already knew that the quality of sound was awesome what I did not expect was that when they claim it has 12 hours battery life at moderate volume levels they were not kidding I have run this thing up to 14 hours not had a single bit of problems its Bluetooth connectivity is great depending on the phone to you might have to look for it once in awhile but it always gets connected and stays connected to my phone when you're running multiple speakers for some reason on YouTube it seems to have some issue switching from one song to the next I discovered later on that this is a range between speaker 1 and speaker 2 if you have it too far away it will try to break up so I recommend keeping them within six feet of each other however the seeming connection issues always resolves itself within a few seconds of the next song beginning audio quality is awesome you really don't need the JBL app with them but if you want it feel free to use it I run mine without and I get perfect left and right stereo I was using a Samsung Galaxy phone I'm now using a moto Z3 and having no issues at all

Its really loud and gets the job done. Claims to have a 12 hour battery life, but unfortunately I cant get it to last for more than 4. Whether it is turned up all the way or not.Update: 3 months later it can barely even hold a 3 hour charge. :/

I do love this little speaker for its color, sound quality, durability, and portability, but the battery life sucks.  It was great for maybe the first year or so, but after a while I had to begin charging it after only using it for about an hour.  I only keep the volume about halfway up, only use it 1-2 times a week, and I don't have heavy bass on.  The battery life is longer with an aux cable instead of bluetooth (naturally), but I find the aux cables don't work really well with this - they get staticky and don't get full volume.  I've gotten used to keeping it plugged in to charge while I use it (though it never shows that it's ever fully charged anymore, even when charging while powered off), but for camping and hanging out by thr pool, I'd certainly prefer the battery life to be much longer.

I could not be more impressed with this product. The sound quality is excellent and the sound levels are impressive. Its so easy to pair with your phone and best part is, IT CAME CHARGED. JBL is doing it right!UPDATE: Still so so happy with this speaker and the battery lasts a very long time, I have listened for 12+ hours at times and the battery still has a fourth charge. And the LED battery life indicators are a big help for when you need to see how much power it has left. The amazing sound of these is impressive. And I have since bought another for a friend because I was so impressed with it. I would recommend this speaker to anyone looking for a good reliable Bluetooth Speaker. Cost 100, would  definitely buy even if it was 200

it get can get loud, not distorted, but maybe muddy? My iPhone 8 speaker sounds better truer quality, even with a lifeproof case on it, the sound quality is night and day. Due to the cylinder shape the sound projection depends a lot on which way you face it and what it's surroundings are. It seems like the bass comes from one side and the higher ranges come from the other. So they do not always blend clearly. Despite other reviews the battery life is my favorite part of this device. I would recommend not over charging. They say you can leave these things plugged in beyond the full charge but we all know that's bs. It severely impairs your devices ability to hold its charge long term. I came across a deal on Amazon and I jumped on it because I always wanted one. It was $60 I think. Normally these are up over $100. I would not be pleased if I bought this for $100-150. Even $60 seems a little high to be honest. Not enough to regret it, but the bass is not as loud as advertised, and overall sound quality is lacking. The material quality on the other hand is what makes it a bargain. I have no doubt it could take a splash of water poolside. But when it comes to sound it basically sounds like a tiny portable radio.

The most annoying thing about this speaker is the lack of track advance (at least) and fast forward/rewind buttons. The much cheaper Oontz speaker that this replaced had that functionality and sounded nearly as good.The JBL speaker wins in that it looks good, is very water resistant so we can use it near/in water without worry, and it really does sound great.

Buenas tardes. Recibi el producto, pero grande fue mi sorpresa al advertir que no trae cagador. Realmente me parece una parte escencial del producto y no puedo entender como es que no viene junto.Cuando uno adquiere un celular siempre trae  el cargador.

So I bought this speaker a couple months ago but waited to write my review to REALLY see the quality of this product. I‚Äôm rating the 2 star simply for the quality of sound....it‚Äôs GOOD for in the House or office. Not so good outdoors if u want volume.The reason for my bad rating is the battery life. I‚Äôve charged this product for plenty of time and yet it‚Äôll still die out w/in an hour or LESS!! There r even times I have it on the charger charging while in use and it‚Äôll STILL DIEü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Very disappointed because I had the older version of this product b4 upgrading to this one and it Performed much better.

I think I just got a defective one because most of the reviews rave over the sound quality. Mine just constantly farts (no smell) and sounds like its completely blown but I haven't even turned the volume up or listened to any heavy metal (yet)! They must have not given the sweat shop kids their daily peanuts and bread crust because this one is just brutal to listen to. I'm surprised it didn't come with a hidden note that said "help me". This is all i can guess because usually JBL does a great job. Watch my video for more info.

I listen to Jazz that has deep base and high horns. I find that when I turned the volume up loud enough to hear the bass, the horns sound harsh. When I turn the volume down to make the horns listenable, the bass goes away. There is a sweet spot in which the bass and treble sound ok, but too quiet to be enjoyable to me. Plus, the speaker is designed not to roll backward, but there is nothing preventing the speaker from rolling forward. Ergo, when I put the Flip 4 on the dashboard of my car, the Flip 4 rolls off the dash when I accelerate. Had to send it back..
Just quit working for NO Reason......Checked online ...many complaints of same disorder.  If you get one...buy Extended Warranty !!!Sounded Incredible...was VERY Happy ...then JUST QUIT WORKING

This summer I needed a new BT speaker and I tried a bunch of them in this size range and this one is by far my favorite.  It's about 95% perfect, which is about 50% better than all the others I tried.  It sounds AMAZING - it's among the loudest of the bunch, and it definitely has some of the best bass of them all thanks to the TWO side-mounted bass radiators.  It sounds better than all of the cheaper models, as well as better than most of the more expensive models.  Probably the SONOS and Bose Soundlink Mini sound better, but they are considerably more expensive and are not waterproof.  That's the thing - the FLIP 4 checks pretty much every box except two, which are relatively minor flaws.  I wanted something rugged, with a decent battery, good controls, great sound, and that was not too bulky.  Probably what we are all looking for.PROS:

I got this in preparation for a century bike ride.  I like everything about it except the volume.  It doesn't get as loud as the Wonderboom.  I want something that I can hear above road noise and wind.  This might do the trick but I don't want to get on the the road and find it gets drowned out by road noise, especially when I know that there is another product that delivers more volume.  It is also not drop resistant, a definite plus for bike riding.If I were purchasing for sound quality, it would be the JBL Flip4 hands down, as I am very very picky about sound quality. But out on the road volume trumps quality.

Lasted less than 5 months. Was a four-star speaker when it worked. Decent sound, good battery life, looks funky (in a good way), could use it in the shower. But now it won't charge (and I've tried multiple cables and connecting it to a computer and also tried praying). The fastest I've ever seen a bluetooth speaker fail, and I've owned a bunch of them, from Oontz to Bose.Adding more to my review now that I've gone through the warranty process. I bought the red specifically to go with my decor. Harman Customer Service told me they couldn't repair or replace the JBL Flip 4 in red because they were out of stock. I pointed out that they listed it in stock on their web site. They replied that the web site is incorrect. So...either Customer Service is lying or their web site is lying. It's now been a few weeks and they did send me a different version in black, which I'm selling on eBay. Meanwhile, the version I bought is still listed as in stock on their web site. You may have better luck then I did, and I hope you do, but I'm done with Harman.

I've had this a little over a year. The battery on it is garbage. Lasts maybe 3-4 hours on Bluetooth then completely dies. You know the battery is getting low because the speaker sound starts to scratch out. Trying to charge it is no good either. More often than not it randomly forgets what it's doing. Can be plugged in all night and I've got a quarter charge. Until I un plug it and plug it back in. Then it might finish..maybe. More hassle than it's worth at this point. Contacted the company and was told since I'm a month past the 1 year that I need to go spend more money with the geek squad to fix it. Very disappointed in this $100 speaker. Not a very good experience with the company either.

The JBL4 flip speaker i purchased a few weeks ago worked great with my Moto G7 phone. The bluetooth connected automatically when both were turned on to bluetooth. I purchased this for a dance exercise class at the beach. We all loved the sound and was able to hear the music and words clearly. However, it would not pair with my iphone7.Then, because I could not connect this speaker with my iphone7 I hit the "forget this device" link on the Moto G7 thinking this would help. It still did not connect to the iphone7 . iphone7 never located the speaker.

Let me be clear from the beginning that this is not a long-term review. I bought this product yesterday. That being said, I have just ordered another one to connect with it. That's how impressed with it I am.I had been using a big Geneva tabletop unit with wonderful sound for years, but it had an unfortunate accident. I bought an Oontz angle 3 to fill in while I made up my mind about what to do next. (It quickly became clear that the Oontz angle 3 is not something I'm going to use for music, though it's's fine for use with my tablet for streaming television. It is very reliable, its bluetooth connectivity is great, but the sound is flat and thin. The Flip 4, on the other hand, has a much richer and fuller sound.  Does it have the sound of my old Geneva unit? Probably not, but I can connect two of these! I can hang it out on the front porch or from a light fixture in the hall by its handy strap. It has connected easily to both devices that I have tried it with so far. I play a wide range of music, from metal to solo vocal, from Indian classical to ambient electronic. The sound is good across ranges.

One of the best bluetooth speakers that I've ever heard. It's light weight but feels durable and high quality. The bluetooth range is great. i had my phone in my phone and walked in my garage, upstairs, and left the speaker outside and it was still playing. I was really shocked by that. If there are any cons, I have yet to notice it.the bass is superb as well. That's a big talking point for this speaker and it does not disappoint. The sound is really loud, that you would think you might get a noise complaint if sitting on your balcony.

Bought this for my daughter for her birthday and she absolutely loves it. I already had the larger JBL myself so i knew they made quality speakers, but this one is just great.  Much more portable than mine since it is smaller, but still has outstanding sound.  And the battery seems to last forever. She‚Äôll go days without charging it, even though she uses it almost every day. Quite frankly, I don‚Äôt think that I will ever buy another portable, Bluetooth speaker, unless it‚Äôs a JBL speaker. I have two now and both are great. Don‚Äôt look at other brands, just get a JBL.

First of all this speaker could be a defective one. Charging was bad, it was disconnecting frequently and turning off as if it was not charged which sometimes I had to used it while it was plugged, but minutes after I unplugged it turned off as if it was dead. Although it was connected to my phone, my daughter‚Äôs phone interrupted my music, sometimes she was watching stuff on her phone and I couldn‚Äôt listen to my music nor she was able to listen to her videos because the sound was stopped for both of us. When she put play my music stopped and when I put play her video stopped. It was just weird! I requested a replacement and I was ready to  The BIG ISSUE is UPS, my daughter told me that my speaker was gonna arrived yesterday, which I was expecting it 5/27/20 and I checked on Amazon and it said that it was delivered at 4:01 pm when I checked it was 4:08 pm, so it was nothing in front of my house (I live in the back on an alley and my address instructions is not to give my stuff to the neighbors because they steal them) so obviously I thought they delivered it to the neighbors.... awkward moment the following day (today) my brother checked the mailbox and it was in it?! So first they lied it was delivered yesterday and I had already started my refund and my comment about how mad I was that most likely my neighbors will be enjoying my speaker and now I had to return the defective speaker and in the end I will have no speaker.. seriously I was already looking to buy the same speaker somewhere else, because I thought UPS gave my stuff to my neighbors. Well, good thing I got the replacement before I bought a new one!

I got the product strictly for in-car use. Fits in the cup holder no problem and has excellent sound quality when in use. I only use the speaker for 20-25 minute drives twice a day. The speaker always comes home or is out of direct sunlight to avoid weather and temperature issues.Battery life based on my usage lasts for about 2-3 weeks when I first got it on a full charge. It eventually stabilized at 2 weeks. I listen to music at half volume.

I wanted to use this speaker so bad. When you feel the weight of the box, open it up and pull out this JBL Speaker, you know you are handling some high quality workman ship. The buttons give immediate feedback. You can just feel this baby in your hands, and you just want to turn it up and start beating to your tunes.......and that is where it kinda starts to make ya turn your head.I actually was able to give it a side by side sound test. The other Bluetooth speaker was of a lesser quality, a cheaper built. It's speaker where a bit larger. Not huge, but larger. It sounded way way better. I will be listening to that instead of this unbelievably build JBL 4 Flip.

Great sound, great durability, and I would definitely purchase one as a gift. I've had friends remark about the sound quality, being surprised it was coming from such a little thing.I've not tested the waterproofness, nor do I care to. It's fine right where it is on the dry countertop away from water sources.

First of all, I have to admit that the audio of the speaker is fantastic. I love it. I took this speaker all over the world with me.After having this speaker for less than two years, I started seeing three major issues:

I got this JBL Flip 4 open box, and if I paid full price, I wouldn't have rated it so highly. However, with the discount, this is one of the best options available right now.Battery life is very good. I don't find myself charging this often, but on the occasion I have to, it's back to full capacity quickly.

I weighed the options of purchasing the JBL Flip 4 vs. one of the similarly positioned Bose Bluetooth speakers, and ultimately went with the JBL because the sound quality was good and, at a sub $100 speaker, if it got lost or broken on the go, it wouldn't hurt as much as the Bose. I was super happy with it until, after only about a year and a half of light-to-moderate use, the battery started to falter. I'm aware of how to maintain lithium ion batteries and was careful not to use it in a way that would reduce the life of said battery. I also know that batteries don't last forever, but in less than two years, the speaker only works if it's plugged into an outlet. Since the warranty only covers 1 year, I guess I'm stuck. After doing some research, I've learned that this is a known issue with with speaker.In hindsight, I should have spent the extra money on a Bose.

I love it!  I paired it to my Android pad before I knew what was going on.  Easy!It has rich full sound.. I was playing music from YouTube on it and it was great.  I also played talk shows from iHeart Radio and SiriusXM.  My pad isn't always loud enough to hear over background noise.  With the Flip 4, I can turn it up and hear everything.  Also, with Sirius and iHeart, I can pause it if I need to interrupt my listening pleasure.  Can't do that with YouTube though.

After a full overnight charge, it played less than 4 hours at half volume before it died. ON THE FIRST DAY?! Says it plays 12 hours. Definitely not worth the price. I have a 25$ speaker that plays seven hours on one charge. Much less running time than I expected. If it needs to be recharged after just a few hours ,it‚Äôs Not enough value for my hard earned money. Its getting returned straight away. Yes, it sounds pretty good, and has decent volume, but if it only lasts a few hours on a charge it isn‚Äôt worth 80$, not to me. Maybe I got a ‚ÄúBad‚Äù one? But then... if you do t have quality control, that‚Äôs on you, not me. Wasted time,and effort....

Recommend new purchasers dunk these in water and test the IP7X rating so you are covered under the warranty.  The IP7X rating says it should be able to be in 3 feet of water for up to 30 minutes without a problem.  However, 2 years after purchasing, it fell in some shallow water off a canoe for just a few seconds and stopped working.  The interior was soaked and had a lot of water came pouring out when I disassembled it to hopefully dry it out.  Sadly it was out of warranty, but nothing was ever done to it that would have broken any seals that it should have taken on so much water in under a minute of being in less than a foot of water.

Put simply, this thing rocks! I have purchased multiple portable bluetooth speakers over the last few years and none compare in sound quality to this little gem. I initially purchased it to use outside when working on the lawn, sitting in the hot tub (since it‚Äôs waterproof) and taking up camping for some quiet background music while observing  the night sky. This speaker provides amazingly clear, beautiful sound that you can take anywhere. A buddy of mine recently purchased this same speaker after borrowing mine for a yard party and being overtly impressed with it‚Äôs ability to cover his large back yard and patio with background music.I listen to a wide variety of music and am generally pleased with the sound quality that this speaker provides. It is not the bass-booming speaker that you might get from a Bose unit but it holds its own with base tones and gives crisp, clear sound ... a quality I‚Äôve found lacking in most of my previous bluetooth units. With it‚Äôs excellent portability, fantastic sound and reasonable price tag I can‚Äôt imagine why you wouldn‚Äôt own one of these.

After exactly 2 years, this speaker has failed. It served me well for awhile - I bought it for a trip to Europe when I wanted music on-the-go. Since then it has mostly lived on a kitchen shelf. It's portable, had nice sound and battery life. The white color was a mistake, I'll admit. It's now the color of a grungy bath towel that's been washed in hard water too many times. Whatever.But about 22 months after I bought it, it started to lose battery life. Now it'll barely last an hour before having to charge again.

Great sound!  I'm thrilled with the quality of the speakers and sound for the price.  I'm not an audiophile, just wanting some decent sound, and it certainly delivers that for me. I like the fact that I can take it around water and not worry so much.  Pros:  Looks and sounds great. Weight is heavy enough to make me think that it's well-made, and light enough to feel comfortably portable.  Cons:  I don't like it's complete cylindrical design because it rolls in such a way as to cause the power, volume, and connection ports to end up on the bottom (backside) out of easy reach.  But, it's not a deal breaker for me because I'm pleasantly satisfied with the other features.  It's just a small inconvenient annoyance. Overall, I'm happy with the purchase.

I have preciously purchased the JBL Clips for listing to music in the shower and they work great. I guess others think they are pretty great too as I have had 2 of them stolen.  So I thought I would try something different this time around and I was pleasantly surprised.  The Bluetooth connectivity is way better with this model.  I used to have to wait a bit or manually connect when someone else had previously been connected.  With this its instantaneously and you can connect multiple devices at once.Example: It's Sunday morning, my brother was taking a shower listening very to music and you could hear it through the door. My mom was in the kitchen cleaning or something when she decided to listen to Sunday Mass on her phone.  And because both of their devices where connected mass started playing over my brothers music.  He was confused and angry because he couldn't get it to stop and my mom was confused because she couldn't hear anything and I just watched from the living room with glee.

I have had one of these for a few months and absolutely love it! So why two stars? Because I decided to get a second and do the stereo thing. The app is effectively useless and confusing. I can not get both speakers to show up in the app. It sees on or the other but not both. Five calls to support resulted in a lot of wasted time and no solution. The first call had me listening to some bonehead telling me I had to have three speakers in order to do stereo! Finally, on the fifth call, I managed to get the problem escalated. No solution yet.Update: I called the company a few times and, on the last call, I finally figured how to do the stereo thing.

This is a great speaker and I ordered 4 because of the ability to link up with each other with out wires (up to 4 speakers).My only "knock" would be that when they are paired up to each of the others, the battery power is used quite a bit. The bluetooth alone is an energy vacuum as it is.

My Flip 3 died a slow and painful death, so I had to buy a new one. Deciding between the flip 4 and 5 wasn't too difficult. I'm a musician, so when I found out the Flip 5 played only in mono it was an instant deal-breaker.The Flip 4 is durable, waterproof, and very loud. I need to turn the volume down to just 3 clicks at work to keep it low enough so my boss can't hear it from his office. However, I blast it literally everywhere else I go. My car stereo is broken so I just set this thing on my dash and it powers through the noise of my open window going 80 up and down the HWY 101. I sing in the shower and it does a great job of overpowering my terrible voice, even when drenched in water, so that's a plus (I'm a drummer, not a singer). I also set it on my hood while washing my carblast week and the whole neighborhood could hear me blasting everything from metal to deep blues to K-pop. I'm just kidding, I don't listen to K-pop.

This thing was horrible.  I cant believe how many positive reviews there are.  I bought it to play my portable synthesizers through while kicking back on the couch or possibly busking.  It couldn't handle any bass.  I wasn't overloading it, I was playing at a comfortable level for watching TV while fiddling around on my synths.  The bass was basically an annoying 'doink'.  I bought a Mackie Home for $15 more and it sounds great.  Yeah, this weighs about the same as a Big Mac, but at the cost of fidelity.... I'd go for the the Prime Rib.

MY SON PURCHASED THIS AS GIFT TO ME FOR MOTHER'S DAY BECAUSE I KEPT USING HIS SPEAKER.  AT FIRST I LOVED IT, THAT WAS UNTIL I WENT TO LOWER THE VOLUME.  INSTEAD OF THE VOLUME GOING DOWN, IT ONLY GOES UP!  THE FIRST MONTH I HAD THE SPEAKER, THE BATTERY LASTED ABOUT 3 HOURS. NOW, THE BATTERY LASTS MAYBE 1 -2 HOURS.  MY SON'S SPEAKER BATTERY LASTS ABOUT 6 HOURS AND HE'S HAD IT FOR A FEW YEARS NOW.  STILL WORKS GREAT.  IT IS BEYOND EVIDENT THIS SPEAKER IS A PIECE OF CRAP.  MAYBE I PAID FOR A BRAND NEW SPEAKER AND INSTEAD RECEIVED A REFURBISHED PIECE OF CRAP?!?!?!  I HAD INITIALLY WRITTEN A REVIEW GIVING THE SPEAKER 2 STARS.  IT IS OBVIOUS THIS COMPANY DOESN'T CARE ABOUT ITS CUSTOMERS OR ITS PRODUCTS BECAUSE OTHERS ARE HAVING THE SAME NEGATIVE EXPERIENCES AND NONE ARE REACHING TO RECTIFY THE SITUATION.  I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.  I ADVISE STAYING AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT.  COMPELTE DISAPPOINTMENT

I purchased both the JBL Flip 4 and the Trelab HD77.  Both are good speakers for their size. I was impressed with the volume output from relatively small speakers, but found the bass disappointing in both.  Lack of bass is to be expected for the small size.  I did find that placing the speakers in a corner or under kitchen cabinets made a material improvement to the lows for each. I think you can get the same effect by placing them in a medium size open cardboard box as the bass reflects off the walls of the box.  I would be relatively happy with both, but ultimately I'm keeping the Trelab as it was 14 dollars less at 66 bucks compared to 80 bucks for the JBL Flip 4.  In addition, the trelab is slightly larger weighing in at 11 ounces compared to 9.2 ounces for the JBL Flip 4.

This beats the Douni A5.  It's smaller, compact but throws big sound.  Not obnoxiously too loud, but loud enough.  I put it on full blast, playing some heavy bass music and it stood the test.  The speakers did not blow out, which I had a problem with my Douni A5.Bluetooth pairs so easy with my iphone.  No stubborn connection at all.  I like the hidden buttons on my camo colored JBL speaker.  The control buttons are in black, but they are embossed, so you can feel them and not have to look where you are pressing.

Bought a 2nd flip 4 because I liked the 1st one so much.  I assumed that - since it's 2018 - the flip 4s would sync and sound great together.  Perhaps I'm missing something but the only way that I can get them to sound good is to link them through the JBL connect app and set them to party mode.  They stay in party mode for just a few minutes and then switch to stereo mode? or something besides party mode and the sound delay is not enjoyable.  The app fails to discover both speakers on a regular basis; even though they are inches from the phone.  I've tried restarting my phone, shutting off blue tooth etc etc.  Googling this issue shows that it's a consistent problem.  JBL should not be touting this product as "pairable".  Alone, the speaker is good.  When trying to play more than one at one time, I'm beyond frustrated.

I'm not a sound buff who sits in a chair savoring the true reproduction of a musical sound track, I just want something to push out a decent sound without distortion while I'm working in my workshop. This does a great job. The sound is full and satisfying. It's easily portable with several hours' battery life. I usually run it from my mobile phone, and the bluetooth connection is dead easy. You can control the volume on either the speaker or the phone.  I like that when a phone call comes in the music is muted, but I don't love that the phone call sound comes through the JBL device. I hope there's a simple way to prevent this, I just haven't bothered to look. All round, it's a great product.

I‚Äôm very glad I purchased speaker. I recieved this speaker as described. You can read the specs, and see that it‚Äôs waterproof and all that good stuff, (although I don‚Äôt plan on bringing it anywhere near the water). The Flip4 has amazing sound quality and great bass. You certainly get your money‚Äôs worth with this speaker. Normally worth around $110, I was lucky enough to get it for $79.95. It‚Äôs extremely easy to pair with your device, right out of the box. From opening the box to playing music from YouTube and pandora took only seconds. And the battery life lives up to its reputation. To put it in perspective, back in the 80‚Äôs and 90‚Äôs, you‚Äôd have to buy a huge, bulky stereo system to get a great sound like this. We‚Äôre living in a time where we get can get something this small and portable that delivers huge sound, so take advantage of it. Great for parties, or if you just use it for relaxation or working out. You‚Äôd obviously get an even bigger sound if you pair it with one or more other Flip4‚Äôs, (which I have not done yet, but plan on it).

After testing some lower quality Bluetooth speakers, I decided to try this one. A coworker has one, one day she was using it and I was amazed at the sound quality, bass, compactness.The speaker is waterproof too, a great feature. The buttons are low profile and work well. It has 2 speakers with bass radiator on both ends.

Considering the price, this is an awesome speaker! Of course, you can find some with better sound quality, greater volume, etc. but those speakers will easily cost you over $100. The sound quality and volume out of this speaker is great; comparable to a Bose Mini Soundlink (a speaker that is almost twice the price, and is not waterproof), and you really can't beat that.The waterproof functionality has worked well for me, although there was a brief period where I probably soaked it one too many times in the shower; the speaker would sporadically turn on and off back and forth multiple times throughout the day (very annoying). However, a day or two of leaving it alone and plugged in solved that issue (no issues since).

This speaker is awesome! The battery charge lasts hours!  The sound quality is amazing, hooks up easily to any phone with Bluetooth capability.  I have used it by my pool, at the beach in a hotel room, driveway party, tailgate and just about anywhere you need to listen to music.  The strap is sturdy enough to hang from a tent or chair. It stands up, it lays down. It‚Äôs even waterproof. It fell in the sand at the beach and I washed it off, shook it out and it was good to go.  Everyone needs one of these speakers!! I always travel with it.  The charger cord can hook up to any USB port. So convenient.  You don‚Äôt even need a wall plug.  This would make a great college dorm gift or gift the person ‚Äúwho has everything‚Äù.  I don‚Äôt leave home without it!

The look and feel of this speaker is amazing, so is the weight of carrying it around. Being waterproof truly helps as well, as I can use it while taking showers.The sound quality compares to Bose SoundLink (which my roommate has) except for may be for the bass, but nothing too. However, where is lags is the Bluetooth connectivity. It works most of the time perfectly with my phone, but goes haywire when I connect with my windows laptop.

I have, over the last year or more, purchased five (5) JBL Flip 4's.
