Two reds, one blue, one triangle-pattern (forget the name), and one "ocean blue" (but promptly returned it when they shipped a standard blue).  I use these at work (production / factory floor) and it is impressive.  I love the water-proofing (mostly for the dust-proof aspect of it) as well as the durability and feel.  Connecting multiple Flip 4's to one another using the link button (near the power button) really opens up the audio experience!  They charge fast, have a good battery life (I work 12-hours+, typically and it holds up the entire day).  Even my oldest, first-ordered unit (red one), still keeps a great charge!  Impressive.I've had a couple of co-workers order some, as they always want to borrow mine (I only have 1 or 2 at work) and they were quite happy with theirs, too.  Overall, the JBL Flip 4 is a solid bluetooth speaker that performs as advertised.

I haven't had the Flip 4 for long, so I can't comment on reliability and durability, but as far as sound quality in a small speaker, I'm very happy with it.  Yeah, it's still has a "small speaker" sound, but it's the best small speaker that I've owned so far.  You just aren't going to get big speaker lows in a speaker this size.  Those tiny drivers just can't push that much air.  Still it does a respectable job.  It's seems very well constructed and if it is water resistant as advertised, it's a great value.  I am using it mostly with my Echo Dot's so far and i like it's portability.  I just tell Alexa what music I want to hear and if I move to another room, I take the speaker with me...within range of course...and the range hasn't disappointed so far. I would definitely recommend.  The only problem is that now,  I want to try all the JBL bluetooth speakers.

I bought this wonderful speaker thanks to hearing the sound from an older model my son bought for himself.  I absolutely love it!!I live in a townhouse with high ceilings.  This one little speaker sends my music throughout the house.  I am listening to it right now.  It is at the top of the stairs in our loft area, receiving music from my iPod which is about 20 feet away in my bedroom.  I hear the music throughout the house loud and clear and so wonderful!  I can do my chores and rock out with my 80s tunes!!

This little speaker packs a real punch for its size. The sound quality on this speaker is very crisp and clear and the base is quite deep. I've owned and tested many other speakers in its class and they can't compare. The durability on this thing is insane! I've thrown it town a 50ft staircase onto asphalt and no problem occurred. I've dunked it in water in multiple occasions and nothing happened. The battery life of this thing is also kind of amazing! But I've got to tell you that this speaker has its limits due to its size. It get the best quality use it in small/medium sized rooms or a small outdoor living spaces. Something this size has its limits. Besides that I highly recommend this speaker if your trying you make your final decision.

You get a whole lotta sound from a small package with the Flip 4. Paired instantly and easily with iPhone and iPad. I experimented with different EQ settings on iPhone and found ‚Äúsmall speakers‚Äù gave the best overall sound for the variety of music I generally play. Flip 4 handles bass, treble, and voice very well. The Flip 4 has volume and other controls that are easy to use but I tend to make those adjustments on the phone. It also can link multiple Flip 4 speakers to really fill the area with sound and now that I see and hear the quality I may get a second one to do just that. It seems very well made and durable but I haven‚Äôt tested the waterproofing and don‚Äôt really want to! Handles phone calls wit clarity. Battery life is supposed to be up to 12 hours, I haven‚Äôt pushed that but it has done 8-10 hr at medium volume without blinking. Like the easy to find bright orange charge cable. I read a number of independent reviews of portable Bluetooth speakers and the Flip 4 was always at the top of the rankings even though the price was middle of the pack. I am happy with This purchase.

I'd give this JBL speaker 5 stars if the was a way to out it down on a surface.  But there is not. Theres a photo or 2 of it sitting on a surface but it is not clear that there is no part of the product meant to lay on a surface. so its meant to hang or be held on your wrist I suppose. I was bummed I had to send it back  it wasn't affordable way to have z fantastic quality portable compact speaker for under 100. But its has th hat ond weird flaw which might be why its sold for less than 100.

I like the quality sound.  What I don't like is that turning it on and off, it makes a loud sound.  You cannot pair two bluetooth device to this when each of them within range of the speaker.  I did (my computer and my phone), and it shuts off my itself every 10 minutes or so.  Once I unpaired  from my computer, it works fine.  Or the computer is not within range (like when I take it to work and pair with my phone only), then it's fine.

This little speaker has outstanding sound quality.  And battery life too.  Love that I can pair it with my daughters and get even more powerful sound.  I bought a very similar 'Monster' speaker from Sam's and tested it out....and there was no comparison with the JBL.  The quality of the JBL allows you to hear dynamic layers of the music.  Other speakers sound "flat" in contrast.  The JBL also sounds loud outside....which is difficult for these little speakers with no walls to reverberate soundwaves off of.  The JBL handles it like a champ!  If you are on the fence about this....just get it.  You won't find a better one.

For it's price, 5 stars. It does what it's meant to do: play sound at a relatively loud volume (or quiet) and not rattle or static the sound. It's been outside, been in the rain, dirt, and been dropped many times and still looks brand new. I havent even needed to wipe it off. Everything just bounces off it. It does fine crammed in a full backpack and is fun to carry around on its strap tied to it that comes with the speaker. Its shape is attractive and smart looking. Just all around really amazing and includes the necessary buttons and plug in ports on places that make sense on the speaker.My only complaint is on full blast with the car windows down on the freeway, it's audible, but not quite loud enough. So its loud enough everywhere but a car freeway, airport runway, and freight train horn.

This is generally a great speaker for the price. There are a few confusing aspects though. For example, there is mention of stereo mode. And there appears to be two speakers, one on each end. But that is not what they are referring to. You can set two of these up in stereo mode with one for the left and the other for the right -- pretty expensive just to get stereo sound. You can also add several more speakers to increase room coverage for events.The smartphone app is not useful, at least in my case. For one thing it cannot find my speaker at all. I have seen suggestions that a firmware update is necessary. That is a terrible design. JBL advertises the app for that speaker and I downloaded the app the same day I bought the speaker. It should just work. PERIOD. But even if it did work, it has very little functionality. It can (theoretically) discover and connect for playing music. But your Bluetooth connection will do that just as easily. You can control the addition of other speakers to create a group of speakers all connected to the same source. That may be its main purpose.

I got this unit in the army green as an upgrade to a failed JBL flip 3 and I couldn‚Äôt have been more excited about it‚Äôs upgraded features,  huge and easy to access buttons, sexy look, and vibrant sound. Sadly, the enthusiasm lasted but a short four months. After said four months, the speaker started exhibiting a strange behavior. First when I would power I noticed that one of the four LED power level lights was out.  Shortly after that, a second LED failed and the next day all of them went the way of the do-do bird.No biggy. I can live without LEDs.  But, a few days after that, I noticed it would not except a charge unless I shook it. Within a week, even the shaking no longer worked and the unit is now a dang paperweight.

Sounds better and is louder than the 3. Looks clean and well made. The sound is far improved to the last gen and other similar speakers. It‚Äôs one of the more expensive for a reason. The distance is great too. I have this strapped to my electric scooter and it‚Äôs able to overcome the wind noise. I take it to the beach throw it in the sand no worries. Did it mention it sounds amazing for a small speaker. Comparing it to others the treble and mids are so much more crisp then others. The vocals come thru clear and don‚Äôt hiss or sting or rattle. The bass is great for speaker of this size but to be honest my ear likes a rounded clear speaker more then a boomy low end heavy speaker most other millennials prefer. So if your a true audiophile then you will appreciate the rich and true highs and mids with a balanced low end. One of the better investments I have made.

Purchased 2 Flip 4's in March of 2018. I use these for my camper primarily. Pulled them out to charge after a month of not being used. Both are completely dead! Neither will power on after charging for hours on separate chargers and cables. Searched the web and many of these fail within the same manner. There is a major engineering fault with this product.I contacted JBL warranty via a web form a few days ago and have not heard back. After looking at their website support, the warranty stipulates that the product must be purchased from an approved reseller. I purchased these units just like you did from amazon and guess what? The order was fulfilled by a vendor that is not on the list.

I have one Flip 4 and am very satisfied with the sound quality so I purchased a 2nd one to link them together for stereo sound and increase the listening area around the house but the JBL Connect feature did not work well (when it worked at all).  Tried pairing the speakers using JBL Connect on two iPhones, they connected but the sound was distorted and often cut out.  Using it on my laptop did not work at all.  Streaming to the first speaker works well as designed but when I pushed the buttons to connect them, it simply disconnected the first speaker from the laptop.  Instructions are nothing more than a few graphics with no troubleshooting guide.  Rather than calling a support number and spending more time listening to recordings, UPS has it now and I'll just be content with the single speaker.

I am a restaurant manager with stagehand and sound engineering experience. This speaker is a good speaker if you play music at 75% volume your less. When working in a loud restaurant sometimes it needs to be turned up louder and this speaker doesn‚Äôt get as loins as some of the others I‚Äôve had so at times, depending on the kitchen, it was too faint to really enjoy.BATTERY LIFE: is a huge issue. Incase you don‚Äôt know, the higher the volume the more power the speaker consumes. I had about 30% battery, I plugged it in to the wall and after about 30 min to an hour it was dead even though it was plugged in.

I really like the range of sound this JBL portable, water-resistant speaker offers.  Super easy to use, and pretty weatherproof as far as I can tell (haven't used it in massive rain).  My one complaint is that you can't rewind 15-30 seconds with the push of a button, you can only skip forward.  So great at an outdoor party when someone doesn't like the song playing, not so great when you're listening to podcasts and the speaker's intonation drops and you miss the last line of the point someone's making.  The point of the durability and limited controls on the speaker itself is so the device with the data on it can be tucked away in a safe place.  That means I need to pull that out from wherever it is safely stored to hit rewind on the streaming device instead of just hitting a button on the speaker.  Wish I had recognized this before I bought several to "hook" together around a large area.  So good sound, nice to look at, does what they say it will do.  Just no rewind.

These things have a pretty good kick to them, especially when paired together. Battery life is a bit low, so if you‚Äôre playing at the max volume, they‚Äôll last around 3 hours or maybe a little longer... the waterproof nature of them is amazing and super convenient for bringing by water without worries. The pairing feature is a little buggy at times but still a very cool feature. When you pair them, one dies significantly faster than the other will so be prepared to have a charger ready for it.If you purchase this, it will only connect with other Connect+ enabled JBL devices. It will NOT connect with regular Connect devices. So some of the Connect+ devices include the Charge 4, Boombox, and Xtreme 2. The Charge 3, Xtreme original will not pair with this.

I love the form factor and sound in most situations.  Some places it sounds great others it sounds marginal.  Placement is important for good sound.  I bring this to hotel rooms when I travel and it works great in that situation.  In a very open outdoor space it is a little less full sounding.  The battery lasts for several hours when it is working properly.  I purchased one a few months before this one and wanted another because I like it so much.  Now just after one year (the warranty period) it shuts down at random and has static sounds when playing.  JBL offered to send a replacement if this one is really defective!  Let's see how this works out.

Been looking for a relatively cheap option for a quality bt speaker to use while golfing and lounging outside, and I think the flip4 is the sweet spot.  20 and 30 dollar products just dont have the same functionality and rich sound you get with this speaker.It's extremely easy to use; I was listening to music within a couple minutes of opening the box. Came with 3/5 bars of battery power.

Out of the box, this speaker has decent sound: good bass for its size (not super powerful, but at you can tell what the bass line's doing). However, it sounds muffled, and of course the fact that its twin speakers are right next to each other doesn't do much for stereo separation or imaging. Comes with the territory of speakers this small, obviously. Fortunately, there's Viper4Windows or Viper4Android, free sound enhancers for PCs and Android phones. Viper's clarity effect deals nicely with the muffliness, and the 3D surround function (field surround on Android) adds some much-needed air. It's still not really compelling stereo, but it makes the listening more enjoyable, at least at close range (like at a desk).Speaker badly needs option to disable powerup/powerdown/bluetooth connect sound effects, and an option to stay powered on when plugged into USB power.

I wanted to try something a little different in a bluetooth speaker. I'm a big Bose fan but my Bose color is a few years old and pretty banged up. The battery isn't holding a charge very long anymore so I decided a new speaker was in my future. I chose the JBL Flip 4 and I'm very pleased with my purchase. It pairs easily to my phone ( iPhone 8 ) and the battery life is fantastic. The sound is just as good if not a touch better than the Color. It is not meant to fill the room but it is very enjoyable to listen to. I'm very pleased with my choice.

I bought this in august of 2018... I still use this, and it‚Äôs May of 2020. That‚Äôs called craftsmen-ship. I haven‚Äôt ever seen any other Bluetooth speaker for less than a hundred dollars last over a couple months. I first actually bought this because I saw how long it‚Äôs been lasting my uncle. When I bought mine(almost 2 years ago) my uncles JBL flip 3 was I believe either 2 or 3 years old then!!! He still uses it and it‚Äôs treated him well. I‚Äôve done my own little forms of(not quite stress-tests) but more towards feature checks. I tested if it‚Äôs waterproof and indeed I have brought it in my neighbors pool for a pool party‚Äôs last July(a year after I initially bought it) and it still was waterproof(and it says something when I dropped my Iphone X in there and it stopped working immediately and it‚Äôs rated for 3m). Everything it says it can do, it‚Äôs done so far. Definitely would recommend.

This speaker is not the smallest but the sound is good. The sound is not as clear as in a good stereo system but I did not expect it from a small single speaker. Nevertheless, the sound is good. It is warm and soft. I preferred it over UE that sounded more spacial and background. The base is not as low as I would like.It is easy to join 2 speakers into a stereo.

The bass output is fantastic, for its small size. The JBL Flip 4 is hooked up to my Samsung Note 9+, and I use it for hands free calls via its Bluetooth. No issues with that. The Bluetooth pairing process is simple, and rapid. Its my understanding you can connect these with another JBL Flip 4, to increase the sound volume, or simulate stereo. I haven't had the chance to try that, though. It is a quality built item, if a bit pricey. Nit-picking; it came with an outrageously ugly orange USB cord. It would be a bit more classier if they mated the cord color to the color of the JBL Flip 4; mine is Black, and the code simply clashes with it.  It fits in my briefcase, unlike the much larger JBL Charge I once had.  Also it would be nice if JBL made a stand or cradle for it. It is the perfect compliment to any cell, or laptop. I would highly recommend it to any potential buyer. Its said to be water resistant; but like any electronics, I wouldn't want to test out that capability!

I bought four of these for a party I was hosting where we didn't have access to the built in speakers. I had a couple options, I have other bluetooth speakers, but I would only be able to connect one to my phone and play from one end of the room. The other option was bringing my bookshelf stereo system from 2004 to the party and spread the speakers out as far as the wires would allow but again it would only be on one side of the room so I would have had to blast both options in order for the other side of the room to hear it, thus making the people closer to the speakers hate me. SOO I found these and ordered four to try out in my situation. I connected one to my phone then the other three to the source speaker. I was able to put one speaker in each corner of the room and flawlessly stream spotify from my phone and have a nice volume level throughout the hall. I had numerous people ask me how I was playing music all over and I introduced them to the speakers. In fact my step father liked them so much he bought two of them from me (I had no need for four after that day anyway so it worked out for me) I have used the remaining two speakers numerous times since I bought them, most recently at the beach on my family vacation. I was able to leave my phone in the truck, stream music to both speakers and provide music amongst 5 pop up tents, the only struggle was finding the kind of music everyone enjoyed! :P
I have smaller bluetooth speakers but wanted something that could be louder. Have used JBL sound equipment before so I know they make good products.The build quality is fantastic and looks great.

I received this in the mail yesterday and I LOVE it! I purchased the speaker in teal. It is a shade or two darker than the picture but it‚Äôs still a pretty color.I love the way the buttons on the speaker press and the sound quality is amazing.

I bought the teal one because I didn't want to have another black speaker in my house, and it's much easier to find! The sound quality is BONKERS! It's so clean and clear (my test song is "Hey Mami" by Sylvan Esso because it's got great bass and fun highs). The battery life is really crazy. I took it on a 1 week road trip, and used it for about 10 - 12 total hours. Never recharged it. But the cool thing is it shows you the battery life (in white circles) when you turn it on. Speaking of turning it on, I love the sound it makes turning on and off, like a fun guitar noise. It's DEFINITELY water-proof. I took it in a pool, and used it in the shower (hung it from the shower head). It's fantastic. I LOVE IT. The fact that you can daisy chain a bunch, and that you can connect multiple devices at once makes it the best. Seriously one of my best purchases of 2018!

Bought this for the shower to listen to music while getting ready for work. Pairing the speaker to my phone was extremely easy. Previous speakers I had lacked range. I can actually walk around my house with phone in pocket and still be connected to the speaker. I have used it about a week, only charging once for the initial charge. Battery indicator only has one of the lights missing. Initial battery life is great. Lets hope it stays that way!

I will leave the technical stuff and basics to others because as Dozer said to Neo, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs major boring sh*t.‚Äù  What you really want to know is how it sounds. This little speaker produces the best midrange you will ever hear from a speaker anywhere near its size.  The highs are also very transparent but perhaps just a tad bit soft. Most folks would probably never notice the roll-off.  There is no deep bass here although mid bass is what I would describe as moderately well presented.  Let‚Äôs be honest. Do you really expect this little enclosure to produce earth shattering bass?  If you do, I have some prime real estate located in the Florida swamps I will sell you at a discount.  However, I promise you will be blown away by the midrange where much if not most commercially recorded music resides.  Clean, accurate and palpable.  Worth every penny.

UPDATE: After 2 months of normal use and enjoyment the volume controls stopped working. I would say minimal use at best for the product. Bluetooth won't connect to phone any longer now either. I would not recommend this product to anyone.UPDATE ON RETURN: I was finally able to acquire a return label from AMAZON "not" JBL, JBL was of no use to me as far as returning defective product after speaking to them on the phone.  I paid $74 for speaker and am getting a $59 credit for my troubles. Buyers beware, I guess I'm lucky to get anything back at all "MERICA"

I ordered the teal version for my wife as a mother's day gift because it's her favorite color and this speaker had generally favorable reviews.  A lot of other portable speakers have unattractive designs or color options, but this hits the mark.  Pairing via bluetooth was easy on an iPhone XR and Android phone.  I have not tested the app, but it's not needed unless you want more advanced options or pairing multiple speakers.  Speaking of, this speaker has the ability to connect to other JBL speakers to create a sort of surround sound environment.I'd highly recommend this speaker to anyone looking for one.  Charges via micro usb and holds a charge for a long time.

I couldn't figure out how to turn this unit On at first.  Lousey instructions!  I went on line and watched a Video and realized I just wasn't pushing down hard enough on the On button.  At first the Unit seemed to have too much Base and I was able to adjust the sound quality via my LG phone using the Equalizer graph and was amazed to see how well the speakers preformed over the entire range of music and different types of songs.  The quality was superb!!!  I'm very happy with the JBL Flip 4 and would recommend it to anyone...

Amazing sound quality, it gets surprisingly loud for its size, & the sound still sounds BEAUTIFUL even turned all the way up.. the battery life is incredible.. it can almost last through an entire bartending shift when I‚Äôm working in the service bar & DJing all night.. I LOVE the color üíòüíò the sea foam green is bright & so pretty. Even comes with a great quality, JBL micro usb charger cord. Very sturdy speaker too. This thing is sturdy AF. It‚Äôs also small enough to easily fit in a purse, drawstring backpack, or even in a sweatshirt pocket.  If you‚Äôre looking for an amazing, high quality speaker to carry with you & use everywhere... camping, boating, work/work sites, beach, parties, hiking, THIS IS YOUR SPEAKER. This is as good as a speaker this size gets. And the price is literally unbeatable. There literally cannot be a better speaker for this price on the market.

The build quality, sound quality, and volume are all outstanding at this price point. However, I have two issues that potential customers should be aware of:1) The Bluetooth connection is not password protected. Essentially, this allows any device within range to connect.

Today it fell off a small chair and kept working fine until I went to charge it. No lights, no power, etc. Couldn't get it to do anything. I wound up opening it up to see if there was something obviously wrong and didn't see anything. I disconnected and connected some of the wires inside and that didn't do anything either.This is the first time I've dropped it, and it only fell a foot or two. I've taken very good care of it and never really did anything crazy with it. Turns out it's not very rugged at all.

Never got it to play.  The printed instructions are a joke, leaving out many crucial steps.  Their phone tech support was somewhere far, far away with terrible audio connection and someone with little English language ability.  Also sounded like she knew absolutely nothing about the device.  Her first day?  So, didn't want to spend another hour trying to get this working.  Will find a better unit.  This is not the JBL that I grew up with.  No idea of the sound quality or battery life.

The sound quality was very good, in the limited testing I did.  My goal was to use these (I bought two) as additional speakers for my TV, or to use them instead of the TV's built-in speakers.  The TV is not natively Bluetooth-capable, so I bought a third-party Bluetooth transmitter (1Mii B03Lite), connected to my TV via optical (TOSLink) cable. I also wanted one speaker to provide LEFT channel only and the other speaker RIGHT channel only, for true stereo, rather than having each speaker provide both left AND right channels.  These speakers ARE able to do this, but only through use of the JBL Connect app on your phone or tablet.  I was concerned that the left/right separation would work ONLY while the phone was connected, which it normally wouldn't be in my scenario.  However, once turned on in the app, the left/right separation continued to work, even when the phone was off and the sound source was the Bluetooth transmitter connected to the TV.  The big problem -- and this might very well have been the fault of the transmitter, not the speakers -- was that there was a 1-2 second delay in the sound coming from the TV, so that the sound did not match up with lip movement.  That made the TV essentially unwatchable.  Because of this problem, I will need to return the speakers and the Bluetooth transmitter.  I will cross-post this review to the BT transmitter, as well, so that people know that it's the COMBINATION of the two that doesn't work as hoped.  The speakers themselves seem to work well, albeit in limited testing.

I purchased 2 of these with the intentions to run them is stereo.  Well I was very disappointed that the default mode to connect 2 or more is mono!  In order to get them to connect in stereo you nave to use the Connect app which is not available for Windows.  Besides the inconvenience with have to use the app, the application only works 50% of the time. and will intermittently switch back to mono when a video is changed in YouTube.  If JBL would release a firmware update to change the default connect mode to be stereo! I will change my rating to 5 stars!  Build, sound and battery life are all excellent!

This speaker is pretty good. Looks good, it can be loud, and its easy to use. There are a few problems though that are significant.1. The bass is hard to hear unless you're playing bass heavy songs. It needs to be like 50% louder.

First things first this is a pretty great speaker, well built and loud rich sound. I use this mainly at work and I have no choice but to max out the volume and throttle the volume with my phone anywhere from 80% to max. This speaker can handle it with no problems. The downside to that is the battery life is about 1.5-2 hours tops in perfect working order. You could maybe get another 30 minutes with a charging cord but it can keep up with the draw. In a home setting or even outdoors you would probably never have to raise past half volume and the battery lasts hours upon hours. My problem currently is the battery and charging system. I may get 45 minutes tops plugged in before it cuts out to continue charging. Turn it back on it shows I have about half charge but cuts back off in minutes. I'm sure I killed the battery after a good year of cranking it to 11. Would still recommend this speaker to anyone looking for big sound in a small package for normal settings around the house and yard or on the move at a lake or park.

The speaker sounds great and has fantastic battery life. However, I bought this to pair it with my JBL charge and the results are just okay. When they are paired and it's working smoothly, the sound between the two is AWESOME! I was a little disappointed at the connectivity though. The speakers must be in close proximity to each other and close proximity to the phone or device playing the music. I would say they can be about 25-30 ft from each other and the device you're playing music from has to be dead center. This is my only complaint, if you move the speakers any further, or walk off with your phone even a little, you'll notice clipping and unpairing. It's a little annoying because when you walk back into range, the speakers dont automatically reconnect, you have to manually go back into the app and re-pair. Battery life is incredible, this weekend I had just this one speaker going at about 100% for an easy 4-5 hours and still had plenty of battery life left.

I bought my first Flip4 from Walmart. It has good sound for a small speaker. I bought my second one off Amazon. It sounds as good as the first. The problem (and reason why I'm returning this one) is that there really is no real stereo when you use two, so having two is pointless. It says it's in stereo mode but there is no difference from one speaker to the other. And when in "stereo more" the two speakers play out of sync. Very disappointing for an $80 speaker.

Please keep in mind my main issue with this is with the app, not so much the speaker.I bought a projector recently and was looking for a good speaker to kinda use as a soundbar, this one popped up and I decided to try it. Overall the speaker itself I love, I‚Äôve never tried JBL before this, instead I‚Äôve always been a fan of Ultimate Ears. My main two complaints over the speaker are I wish it had flotation like the UE products do, and when using the aux plug-in if the audio you‚Äôre playing has a ‚Äúquiet‚Äù moment, the speaker will stop playing, and once it ‚Äúdetects‚Äù sound again it‚Äôll have a 0.5 second delay, which for some people that can turn you away, especially since I use it while playing movies/video games and a lot of those have quiet moments and in the process of coming back it‚Äôll miss a character‚Äôs short line of dialogue or an important audio bit. This isn‚Äôt a problem I‚Äôve had while using Bluetooth though.

UPDATE: it‚Äôs now August 2019, and after a year of normal use, it now only holds a charge for 20 minutes and refuses to charge fully.I bought this having been impressed with the JBL flip 3 that a friend brought along on vacation. After years and years of just sticking my phone in a bowl (which never really gets *that* loud, let‚Äôs be honest), I decided to invest in this, and figured the newer version would work just as well (only major difference between the flip 3&4 seems to be the waterproofery, I think?). Can‚Äôt beat it for price/quality/portability combo. Color is super cute too! I was/am very impressed with the packaging and the fact that it was mostly charged out of the box. It gets VERY loud (can hear from every room in my house) and has great bass. I love that it fits in a cup holder too. Would definitely recommend! (haven‚Äôt tried getting water on it yet, and hopefully won‚Äôt need to).

First 'played' with one of these speakers when my girlfriend's son visited. . . . then left his Flip 4 speaker at our house!  I started playing around with it: paired it to my I-phone. . . . and Whoa!!  I was blown away by the amazing fidelity, and presence of the sounds!  Extremely solid construction, and water proof as well!  I perform live music with students, and plan on using this great speaker to share pre-recorded songs, and background music for movement activities.JBL has always been one of the top audio manufacturers, and has again hit a 'home run' with this new device!

These speakers have not been working right since I purchased them a year ago. After playing for about ten minutes the Bluetooth connection becomes unbearable and skips and has fuzz. I thought it was my phone‚Äôs fault this whole time but after using my brand new phone with these speakers they had the same problem :( I am ready to throw them in the garbage it‚Äôs so frustrating having skipping music I turn it off after ten minutes every time. I cannot listen to music like this!!!!!

So it sounded great. Much better than my first BT speaker, Anker's Soundcore. Of course, this one is more than double the price and it did sound about twice as good. Unfortunately, it has a bit of a hiss when plugged into power and idle. I have the speaker on a little shelf at the head of my bed and listen at night if I wake up and can't go back to sleep so it is always plugged into power and always connected to Echo Spot. I really liked it and wanted perfection but if I didn't have something playing it would hiss and after a few days of being connected it would have a little click or actually more of a micropause very regularly every 3 or 4 seconds. It resolved with restarting the speaker, and honestly, I'm not 100% sure this part was the speaker's problem or Alexa's problem but since it also had the hiss, I had to return it. I know most people don't keep it connected and plugged in all the time so it may not be a problem if you regularly cycle the power and turn it off when not using it.

Let‚Äôs start off with the things I don‚Äôt like. First to support the cons, you need to know that this speaker is quite compact and isn‚Äôt this huge speaker to be able to create a large bass sound. This leads me to my one con. I‚Äôm not one to listen to a lot of bass heavy music but this speaker doesn‚Äôt have the most bass. In it‚Äôs class, I do believe that this speaker takes the win for bass. It does have bass though for listening to just about anything.Now to talk about the pros, on the exterior appearance and ruggedness of the speaker, this thing is great. I have the ocean blue and it is quite a sexy color. I bought the gray one before and gave it to my brother and his is still kickin‚Äô. The Bluetooth connectivity is flawless without a doubt. The battery life stands tall and it doesn‚Äôt take forever to charge. I can even use a portable battery pack to charge it and it charges even faster. If you keep the volume at about half it lasts quite long.

The speaker and overall build quality are very good, however, it's really a shame they don't support higher quality streaming that's been out for awhile. At their price point, they really should.Additionally, the sound quality seems to get worse when pairing more than one speaker.

I‚Äôve owned one of the first generation flips for many years.  I have always been impressed with the sound produced by my older flip and the Flip 4 is just as impressive.I bought two so I could take advantage of the Connect+ features.  Then I decided I could replace an old set of Wireless party speakers I‚Äôve had for several years with these, so I bought two more.  They sound terrific and fill my home and yard with clear deep music when I use them.

They really missed the mark on this one. If you want a paper weight or a mantle piece this is the product!I will admit if it can hold a charge it sounds good. But when the battery can‚Äôt last more than an hour or so at higher volume you‚Äôd never know. Seriously, even when the speaker is plugged into an outlet it doesn‚Äôt keep the power on. Still a fan of JBL but this one is garbage.

We have an older Bose Mini II and enjoy the sound of it, however we wanted a 'cheaper' speaker that could set near the pool or lakeside or on a picnic table at the campground and not worry about being damaged by moisture.  Our speaker has never been submerged or directly splashed with water, but it has been exposed to high humidity, fog, and dew, when left out overnight and it works great and has better than expected sound.  I am truly impressed with the sound for this price point.

I don‚Äôt beat up my speakers or anything. Right at about a year, the battery started screwing up. Would say fully charged in 5 minutes. Then die. Then it started turning off and on throughout the whole day. JBL offers no way for me to get it fixed.  For a $100 speaker, I expect more than that. And their battery is awful. I like their products but they just don‚Äôt last. Pretty disappointed with JBL.

i bought it in december of 2017, and now, suddenly, it stoped working. I really mean suddenly. It was a really good product, with an amazing sound. I really enjoyed it, but from a day to the other, its battery is not holding up any charge. I charge it to 100%, and it won't last more than 3min. Really upset, since its from one of the best sound brands available. Worst of all is that this problem started to appear from one day to the other. Witch indicates its a fabrication problem.

Really happy with this purchase. I live by myself, so I don't need a super fancy audio set up because I'm usually using headphones. That said, I wanted something I could use outside when I have friends over to grill in the summer. This has worked perfectly so far, the battery life is long, and the sound quality is stellar for its size. Really nicely balanced. An added benefit that I didn't anticipate is the fact that I can use it to listen to podcasts/audio books as I'm falling asleep and plug in my phone in another room entirely. (When I plug my phone in in my bedroom overnight, I end up wasting a bunch of time in the mornings.) The battery lasts for several nights this way. (I do use my sleep timer on 30 or 45 minutes.)

I bought these speakers to use in my clinic treatment rooms. I liked that they could pair together with bluetooth and play the same music from one device. However, the noise is constantly cutting in and out and creating static and everyone always asks if I'm playing a scratched CD. I spent so much money on these I have been hesitant to replace them, but I will have to. The speaker connections to one another is extremely faulty and I wish I never would have purchased these. As a stand alone speaker they are mostly okay but for JBL I expected a LOT more. Very unhappy with this purchase.

I cant say enough about this thing. I have ranted about it so much my friends and family heard it and purchased as well. Perfect sound for the size. I am a heavy traveler and take this everywhere. Hokds an awesome charge, sounds crystal clear with a little thump. Perfect for outside and fills the house with sound. I connect to my tv and sounds so much better than the stock tv speakers. Now with connect plus, you can connect numerous speakers together. I comnected mine and my Dads and sounds amazing. Need a liitle more bass? Use connect plus and an extreme and the neighbors will love you. These things are well worth the price, and live the JBL sound. Move over Bose, you have competition.

Where's the option for 10 stars? This has jaw-droppingly rich sound. I couldn't believe my ears as I stood in awe listening to this play 2Cellos' "With or Without You." The acoustics are absolute perfection; crystal-clear, with base notes having real depth and vibrato to them as if I were listening live. Simply amazing. I bought this because my friend had a waterproof speaker from another brand that we took kayaking with us - hers cost twice as much as this one but this one is smaller and sounds incredibly better. I am in auditory heaven!UPDATE: 7/23/2017

Great speaker. Excellent frequency range and clarity. I work in a diesel shop and I can hear it really good and for me with the speaker at 60%ish volume on a full charge it lasted 7.5 hours which I'm fine with. Really impressed with the battery life to sound quality ratio. Down side is that I never heard a low battery warning. But then again, I work in a noisy shop. I've had it for a week and am very happy with the purchase. It's also cool to watch the subwoofers on the side.

Bought this for my backyard to link up with my JBL charge 3. Took forever to link up, had to link it by the app but once it finally got done I was able to link them together.The flip isn't as good as the charge 3, I should of just bought another charge 3.

I ordered this waterproof Bluetooth speaker to take with me while kayaking and it does not disappoint! It fits perfectly in the bottle holder forward of the seat. During the latest kayak trip a small storm rolled in causing choppy waters. As the waves buffeted my small craft the speaker was drenched in water. It even sat in standing water as the bottle holder filled up. Nonetheless it continued playing the entire time without any problem. It has great sound for being about the size of a pint beer can. It won't fill up a room, but it isn't meant to. For the beach, water sports, biking, hiking, and all kinds of outdoor and indoor activities where you want portable sound, this is great! Also, you can apparently connect up to 100 of these together and have them all play from the same source. I might get another...Update: got another speaker and have been unable to pair them together in stereo mode! The app that you need to get them to work together is terrible! Reduced my rating from 5 stars down to 3 because of the abysmal app.

Quality little bluetooth speaker.  Sounds good, especially when i'm watching movies on my ipad or laptop when I'm on the road.  I don't know if the sound is any better than other similar speakers, but the selling point for me was the integrated speakerphone/microphone for the speaker.  It really improves the sound on conference calls using my cell phone.  There have been times multiple people were gathered around my iphone, but this works great and sounds way better.  I originally purchased the flip5, but exchanged it for this one because of the speaker phone option.

The sound quality on this product is amazing no matter what the Volume is, I'm writing this review on March 2020, have had the speaker since November 2018, it was all great until a few days ago when the speaker will not last half an hour at a medium-high volume, it will start making weird sounds and turns off. Seems to be the battery is dead, I gave it an average use over the months, it used to last a week and a half or 2 weeks on a charge based on the use I had with it. Don't really know if this time frame is fair for the battery to die, or if something went wrong with it and it's an early death. I would definitely buy one again, however, I do think it went bad earlier than expected.

I'd like to start this off by saying this, the speaker was great while it worked. I am a college student, and I bought this speaker thinking it would be great to play some music while hanging out with friends in the dorm, maybe while I'm taking a shower, etc. It was a bit pricey, but the reviews were good and I had a few friends that said nothing but good things about it. Now, I have had it for a few months and I can't use it any more. One day the power and linking button's stopped working, the LEDs and everything. So while the speaker still worked, I couldn't turn it on or off. Eventually it died and now I can't use it.I am very disappointed in this product as it was marketed as being durable, however, didn't last more than 4 months of mild use. I would not recommend you buy this product if you are looking for a product that would last.

ok I have 2 boys and a husband who loves music. We have been through our fair share of portable speakers. I even just in the last year purchased a small portable Bose (the small squarish one) and this speaker completely blows it away.This is actually our 2nd time to buy this one. The first one was for my son, and this one was for me. You can pair the 2 together and get great surround sound, they are handy by the pool, or water and seriously, they sound AMAZING!

The JBL Flip 4 has amazing bass and it is the best portable speaker that I have ever had! The sound quality when turned up high, is amazing as well! The only thing I dislike is the battery life. I definitely have not gotten 12 hrs battery life out of this in one charge like it says you will get. But it charges fast and I hope that it stays that way. I also was able to listen to music while it charged. I read a review where someone said you cannot listen to music while it charged, but I did! Also, I work in a huge kitchen that serves 750-800 people each meal, and this speaker can be heard above all of the choas of everyone in the kitchen and it isnt even turned up all the way, the sound stays crisp and clear, good job JBL, Thank you!

Love this speaker. My favorite wireless speaker I've ever purchased. Crisp uppers, clear mids, and booming bass. Not to mention when paired with a travel case it is an amazing travel speaker. I always have the travel case latched to my travel backpack so its a zip up away for a trip or going out. Its a very sturdy speaker in regards to water and dropping. I haven't tested this but it is evidently water proof. It has a long battery life too. I can listen for a few hours and see now drop in its 4 or 5 battery level indicators. From what Ive read, the only speaker I would look at instead of this is its practically identical Charge 3 or 4? I guess its an even more powerful version of this speaker. Which is surprising because this thing is amazing.

When I received my Flip 4, I was impressed with the sound and ease of use.  However, almost immediately, it started to skip in a random pattern.  Sometimes it played for a a few minutes before skipping.  Boy, was that annoying.Instead of using my computer and Bluetooth transmitter, I switched to my phone's Bluetooth and the pattern continued.  Thinking the Bluetooth range was limited, I tried using the Flip 4 right next to my phone, and right next to my computer.  No luck.

I chose this speaker because I've had excellent experiences with JBL and wanted  high quality.  After receiving I had trouble getting my iPhone and laptop to recognize it.  I contacted this seller thru Amazon to explain my problem and ask for help.  The owner of the store contacted me immediately and patiently walked me thru the process.  Later his technician called to follow up.  Customer Service is what it's all about.  They went above and beyond what I normally expect from a seller.  The speaker is exactly what I expected and this seller was amazing.
These sound good and overall work well if you use only one of them.HOWEVER...

This is hands down, the best purchase I made last year! I have decent audio systems in the house, but find myself using this more often when I'm just in the kitchen, or when I'm in the shower, or when I'm outside. It works well outside when we have BBQs, and is loud enough for our backyard. It's definitely loud enough in the house and can easily fill a large room. I often use it as a car speaker when I'm driving my vintage car that doesn't have speakers. It's good even with windows down. The sound quality is excellent with good balance and mids, and the waterproofing is a nice feature since I use it when camping too. It's super rugged and durable... used it a ton and have taken it many places this last year. It charges fast, and the battery life is great! It'll last a decent chunk of the day on higher volumes.

Bought this due to the connect+ feature to connect with my teammates on bike rides - and because it was a great deal on Black Friday. I haven't used that feature yet as winter has stopped all of our team rides, but I've taken it out on my own several times and it is GREAT. The sound quality and volume have topped any of the several other speakers I've tried and it's gone through mud and slush with no difficulties. On top of that, the battery life is great - I use an old iPod Touch for music when I ride to avoid killing my phone battery and the speaker outlasts the iPod's battery life. Very excited to get lots of use on the trails without having to charge it every single time!
The box had been opened.Did I get that 1/1000 lemon?

Sounds ok, but my Boss SoundLink Mini II sounds much better. I do like that the Flip 4 is weather resistant, and it's more mobile-friendly than the Bose. It's great for taking to the pool.  The battery charge lasts longer, too. Wish it came with an adapter with the USB cable. Overall, it's worth the money.

Been listening to it a bit here and there since it arrived a couple of days ago. My Avantree Cyclone was stolen so I found myself in the market for another small portable Bluetooth speaker. I liked the (decent enough) sound from the Cyclone and the basic cylindrical shape, and I kept these factors in mind whilst searching for a replacement. After reading through many lists and reviews I settled on the Flip 4. Although I haven‚Äôt much previous experience with JBL products, this speaker seems to be good value for the money. Nice features, quality of sound and handy size. Everything arrived as advertised, super easy to set up and start using right away. For people bagging on this small speaker not having enough bass, I don‚Äôt know what their experiences or expectations are, but I think it has a good, balanced sound between bass, mids and highs. Perhaps those complaining need to make appropriate adjustments to their EQ‚Äôs for the music they‚Äôre listening to? This speaker cost over twice as much as my Cyclone, and I‚Äôm hoping it serves me as well in the foreseeable future. I can't speak to battery life just yet, haven't had a chance to give it a workout yet. Thanks for reading.

Great little speaker until it wasn't. Worked great for almost two years. Then one day it wouldn't turn off. Just would not turn off when pressing the power button. Googled and found a factory reset trick. Didn't work. Had to disconnect from Bluetooth on my phone. Battery eventually died. Plugged it in to recharge and it lit up like it was recharging, but now will not turn on. Very disappointed. Called JBL and they said it's out of warranty and can't do anything. No suggestions. So frustrating that everything is "disposable" now.

I replaced my iphone to the 11. I had to reset the device because it would not brodcast the bluetooth signal. While doing this the Flip powered down. It looked like it reset. However, Now it will only light up when I plug it in. The battery is new and the device is not that old. When researching the issue it is a known issue. The board that controls the buttons has gone bad. Now it is a just a paper weight. I will never buy JBL again. This is a known issue that they have not fixed.Update... contacted JBL and they replaced the item without any issue. I have changed the rating to 5 star.

I've been using it almost daily for 20 minutes to 2 hours for almost 1 1/2 years now.SOUND: It sounds almost as good as a full blown stereo system, if not better depending on the stereo. The only thing that makes an actual stereo a little better is the fact the speakers aren't combined into one unit and the sound comes from multiple directions (but I'm tempted to get a 2nd one to fix that).

This is an amazing speaker.  I've used it multiple times on our back patio, around bonfires, working around the house and more.  As long as you have a good wireless network, this connects flawlessly and sounds great!  For the price, I highly recommend it.  If your expectations are higher, then spend more money on something else.  For me, this is perfect for the price.

I must say that sound is rather disappointing. This speaker is way overpriced for the sound quality it delivers. If you‚Äôre looking for a small, portable speaker to take for a trip, or to the beach, it‚Äôs okay, though even than it could be smaller. If you not that concerned with portability and looking for a great sound for a deck or backyard or even inside, this is NOT the speaker to buy. Try Harman Kardon Onyx Studio instead that you can get for about $100.

First of all the JBL Flip 4 sounds great, no doubts. Unfortunately the unit has a bad battery that dies shortly after a couple of months. First you will start noticing the battery last less than usual, then it takes longer to 'fully charge'. Mine started this way, now it's useless, it can take several hours to supposedly show fully charged and it may work for 15min before dying.Warranty? I've never heard anybody was granted a replacement.

Just took this to Mexico so I could play my music. Quality of sound is very good. It is light enough to easily pack and it made my cocktail parties a big success. Very easy to connect and price is so reasonable. I looked at lots of options but didn‚Äôt want to spend more than $100 and after reviewing the reviews I decided to take a chance and I am really happy with this choice.

Have only had this speaker for a month and already I‚Äôm having battery issues. It dies really fast when playing, and will shut itself off despite being plugged in. It will not charge and play at the same time. Now it suddenly doesn‚Äôt want to charge at all. Plugged in for an hour and only blinking light... not building up a charge. For the cost of this speaker I expect FAR better.

One of the best speakers you can buy. FW update gives you a little more bass. The size the sound the speakerphone everything is great on this speaker. This is my 5th Flip 4. Rather have this than a Flip 5. Looks great in white. Still the champ in this size and category. Crisp clear and a deep rich bass for this size.

We love our JBL!  We purchased as it interfaces with our Peloton bike.  I really wanted the in studio feeling - (I like loud music when I work out) so it works perfectly for this!  It's also great as we can grab and go with it if we are taking a trip or out where we would like some music going.  My only feedback would be - it would be great for this model to also come with some sort of base or feet that can help it sit up nicely.  The ends are the bass so I hang it from the cord (not the charging cord) it came attached with from a hook near the bike!  But, I would prefer it to be sitting near us without having to stand it on end or it roll away.

I use it by the shower since it is waterproof.  It works very nicely and sounds pretty good for such a small speaker.  I feel like the battery life isn‚Äôt as long as it‚Äôs supposed to be, but that‚Äôs not such a big deal to me.  I do wish it had buttons on it that would allow skipping to the next song, so that I don‚Äôt have to touch my phone when wet (although it‚Äôs waterproof too, I try not to).  It only has volume buttons, play/stop, and a Bluetooth button.

If you are looking for great sound quality, long battery life and the ability to connect two speakers for great sound in a large area (or just use one), without spending $100's of dollars- your search is over. My son got one of these a few months ago and I liked his so much that I bought my own. He uses both of them at times. Sound quality ‚úîÔ∏è Battery life‚úîÔ∏è Price point ‚úîÔ∏è All of this and it's waterproof too!! We will definitely be using these by the pool, at the lake on the boat and take them in the jet skis for when we stop to swim. You will not regret this purchase.

Not just when the microwave is on, but just does not play for a second or two every once in a while.  If you shut it off and restart it, it works again. Pain to turn on both speakers and get them playing at the same time every time you want to enjoy.  App is pointless.  BUT I love JBL and they sound great!  But honestly not as clear or loud as my speaker from 12 years ago when I fell in love with JBL, but hey, they are waterproof...

Let me start by explaining I used this sparingly over the 8 months. Mostly to trips overseas, poolside. At first, it was a really cool joke to pull on people.....(Sir/Maam, can you hold this for me, then drop it "accidentally" into the pool and watching people's faces during and after I pull it out of the water. Absolutely hilarious.)However, on my last trip I packed it in my carry on, and never used it. Took it out and tried to use it over labor day weekend.....to find it completely dead. I mean, I literally could not have used it more than 30 times. I think it maybe the battery may have been faulty. I am in the process of RMA'ing this but I am completely annoyed that I have to go through the hassle.

It might be a little pricey but I think it's worth it. I really love this speaker. it came really professionally packaged, with foam and a magnetic box. was super easy to connect to my phone. The speaker feels really solid in your hand, and doesn't feel cheaply made. I have been using it for the past week and I only have charged it once. The battery life lasts very long if you remember to turn it off when not using it. The sound quality is really nice and loud, and fills out a room well. the bass is actually really good, and you can actually feel the bass at the top and bottoms of the speaker. shipping was easy and came quickly with no hassle. one thing is when it is standing upright since the bottoms aren't perfectly flat it tilts a little bit, but that just annoys me and doesn't detract from the product. I love the fact that it's waterproof so I can use it in the shower. Overall I am super satisfied and would recommend this to anyone who wants to invest in a good quality durable speaker.

For this price range I find the sound of this speaker to be excellent. It has an excellent range of sound concerning treble and base. I personally prefer this over the beats pill plus and I like the sort of fabric mesh that lays over the drivers. At the end it's like a hard rubber or tpu in case you drop it it'll take the shock of the drop. Over all, I am thoroughly impressed. If your wondering why I gave it only 4 stars it's because it's no sennheiser. The most bang for your buck and you can't tell it's cheap say like a soundbot model.In the photos the blue USB is a separate cord, but still USB, and the Orange one is the one that is provided with the speaker. I found that to be unique and useful that the pin portion was flat versus the standard USB.

I love this speaker to take to the beach, pool, or anywhere outdoors. The sound quality is great and the volume gets pretty loud, but the battery life is horrible. It takes maybe 2-3 hours to fully charge and will be completely dead after about 4 hours. I have to charge this hours before I plan to use it and sometimes it dies within the first two hours. I really wish the battery lasted more than one use, it's super annoying trying to entertain with this speaker because it will likely die in the middle of it. Luckily I have a larger speaker that plugs into the wall, but I still use this for shorter duration outside.

For those considering this over hyped product; this particular example is adequate to listen to low levels (easy to talk over in a medium quiet voice) background music, at distances of arm length or more from the speaker; AFTER the painfully bright high frequencies (above 1K Hz) have been equalized own from 1 to 3 on a Samsung phone equalizer display.The Samsung phone volume is at 9-10.

I love the sound of this speaker, I often have to listen to music at about half volume because the sound is that loud. The only thing I can say that I don't like about this speaker is that it likes to have pairing games with a device that gets paired to another device besides itself. It will stop playing sound about a minute into playing. Then I will have to take it off and reset the device and repair it as a new device. So most of the time I keep it paired to only one device .. so it don't get jealous so to speak. Other times I will simply use the headphone jack, so that it won't shut itself off if idle. The sound quality is awesome though, so for that factor I can work with her a bit when she has her days. LOL

I was very happy with the sound of the Flip 4 however after a few months I noticed the battery life started to diminish considerably. The battery life would last approximately 30 to 45 minutes going from a full charge indictor light to a blinking red light and then shortly after shutting off. I had to resort to keeping the Flip 4 plugged in order to work. Two weeks ago while listening to music high frequency sounds would start to distort and after a 10 to 20 second period the speaker would automatically shut off. After turning the speaker on the same high frequency sound distortion would return shutting my Flip 4 off rendering it basically useless. It works on most occasions if I am listening to vocal commentary but if I am listening to music the same high distortion problem occurs. My Flip 4 warranty has expired and I attempted to have it fixed but the two repair centers JBL recommended told me they don't fix Flip 4s because its economically unfeasible to do so (e.g. $50 just to diagnose the problem on a unit I spent $80 new for).In spite of this mishap I have been a fan of JBL Speakers. I really enjoy the sound. Years ago I had a JBL Flip 2 that stopped working after a year. I believe I was to blame for that speaker since I unfortunately exposed it to moisture. I have a Charge 2 that stopped charging and would no longer work even when plugged into the wall. The Charge 2 was out of warranty so I couldn‚Äôt get it replaced. So having my third JBL speaker not work for me has proven to be a huge disappointment.

My mother has the JBL Xtreme 2 so I already knew and loved the brand. However, that one is way too big for me to have in a college dorm. That‚Äôs why I went with this smaller one and I swear it basically carries the same strength! It gets super loud and has this surround sound effect to it. The music sounds so complete with this speaker and it‚Äôs the perfect portable size. 10/10!

The speaker came quickly and I have been more amazed everytime I use it at the quality of the sound given the size and price.  It is by far my favorite portable now.  The battery life is excellent. A side plus is the all the extra stuff that you can buy ie. cases and carrying straps and other stuff.  I am tempted to buy another one given the current prices and color selection. Can't say enough good about JBL Flip 4.

Hands down one of my favorite purchases. $80 can be a loud number, but so is the speaker. It handles any bass boost flawlessly, and the sound carries a very good distance. The JBL link feature works wonderful when friends bring their speakers too, becauze the link system lets us have surround sound with no delay between speakers. Charge lasts a long, long time, even on full blast.I've taken this speaker across the country and on all kinds of excursions and it has performed without fault. I use it on runs, hikes, showers, snowboarding, parasailing, or even just to drown out someone else's music. I would recommend not letting it play music underwater (if you drop it in a pool or such) for very long as the water will leak into the power button. (Doesn't affect performance or get into the actual speaker, but takes a while for the water to evaporate out.)

I purchased the same product about 1.5 years ago but made the mistake of buying it refurbished to save a few bucks. The battery eventually wore down to holding less than an hour charge and before the first year was up I couldn't recharge it anymore so had to dump it. But, this same model is at such a great price I'm buying it new and love it! the sound is huge from this small speaker, it fits in a golf cart perfectly, holds a charge for about 7 hours so far at 100% use, and the price is great! I did my research and this is the best model unit for the sound and price. You won't be disappointed. And buy new, refurbs are a waste of money.

A speaker is only as good as its battery life. This one is pathetically short especially when playing at loud volume (using it outdoor it HAS to be loud). Called when I noticed issues with it and customer service refused to replace it. There‚Äôs plenty other good options out there so I would suggest looking elsewhere.

I bought this after  my Radio Shack cheapie finally gave out. I thought I would upgrade since I really like that these speakers usually sound great.  They're great for my office!  I bought another for my house.  I just hang it out on the patio when we're by the pool and you have no problem hearing them.  If you need more sound, you can link another to it.  When I know I'm going to have more people over, I just take the one from my office home and link it and set it on the other side of the patio.  This way everyone has music.  They're not as light as my other speaker, but I'm assuming it's due to the quality.  These sound 100 times better and fill the room.

This is the 4th small blutooth speaker I've owned and by far the best.  It blows the Oontz angle out of the water in terms of volume and bass.  This speaker works best in a smaller space without too much distance between it and the listener.  For it's size the bass is really great.  That said if you take it outside or into a large room it tends to feel a little tinny at high volumes, but for it's size I think it's the best in this category aside from maybe a bose.  Very happy. Definitely above average blutetooth speaker. Fine for bedroom listening. Bass is good. Terrible a tad tinny.

This JBL bluetooth speaker has really great sound for it's size.  I tried lying it down and standing it up and think the bass is a bit better standing up.  Also, the bluetooth connection range seems to be pretty good as I can move with my phone into another room in my house away from the speaker without any disruption to the sound.  And I would add that for the price it was a pretty good value.

The sound is really good. But the sound doesn't match up with the lips when you're using bluetooth... which is more of a bluetooth problem overall. If I had known I would've tried to get an RF wireless speaker.Also, the bass is so loud you have to turn it off to listen to movies. But it won't turn the bass off from the PC it has to be turned off from the speaker which requires you to hold the bluetooth and lower volume button at the same time for like 15-20 seconds. Which is a pain in the ass and something the instruction booklet didn't tell you about.

This isn't a bad speaker... While it looks nice and is water proof/resistant... It's a bit overpriced for what you get. You pay for that JBL name brand, really.  There are better, slightly larger speakers on the market with far more bass, that are also waterproof... for a lot less money.Because they're small, they fit well inside of a small camper or tent situation. They do get loud, as well. Battery life is nothing to be amazed by, it's average.

I got this after having a isound glow tower. The isound was very good for the $50 price, I wanted something louder and with longer battery life. The flip 4 is great, has good bass sound and lasts for hours! I have used it for 4 hrs straight on 3/4 volume and its still playing on lower volume in the house a hr or 2 a day 3 days later! I love that it will pair with another flip4, saving up for another one! Great speaker for just under $100.

Freaking love this thing and take it everywhere. I'm a musician, so I really appreciate the well balanced and detailed sound for what this is. Portability is great, calls actually work well on it, battery lasts an entire day by the pool (can confirm waterproof status as far as it won't kill it, but don't expect it to sound good in water). It also feels really, really solid. Like you could definitely knock someone out with it.It's bassy enough for me, I've got a JL ported 8" box in my truck if that tells you anything... I like balanced sound, not overpowering bass. I read entirely too many reviews of Bluetooth speakers in the range, and compared it to the UE Boom in best buy. Sound is somewhat subjective, but I found the UE sound to be a little thin in the midrange but had slightly more dynamic imaging in a room, but if you're using it outside I'm not sure that will show. The Flip 4 sounds fuller, warmer, while a bit more direct.

Only had this product two days but it‚Äôs quite powerful.  It‚Äôs a great product BUTTTTT it came without a charging cord. Odd to receive a costly speaker without a charger cord.  Not sure of battery longevity.UPDATE:  have product now for a good week.  Again... no charger card came with product.  Thought I could get over that BUT the dern thing will not stay on.  Keeps shutting off.  Returning this üí© Monday morning!

I just got it, and I already hooked it up to the Bluetooth and wow, it sounds great! It‚Äôs little smaller then I expected, but like the fact that it‚Äôs a little more compact. So far it‚Äôs only been a few minutes, and I love it!  Has some good weight to it, great sound, cool looking, and it‚Äôs waterproof, which is very cool. I bought the camouflage one. I can hide it in the bushes. Lol.I was just excited over my new Bluetooth speaker, I had to write home about it

Sounds fantastic!  An unexpected sound out of a small, little speaker.  It's also splash proof!  I could not ask for a better portable speaker.  Easily syncs to your devices Bluetooth and holds charge for several sittings of listening to music.  The volume is also controlled from your phone or device which is great because you do not have two different items you must control the volume on.  If your phone or device is on max volume, so is the speaker and vice versa.  Amazon also beat the price of other retailers.  I was going to buy the item at Wal-Mart.  Taxes and all was approximately $108.00.  Amazon beat the price significantly.  I am very impressed with this portable Bluetooth speaker.  Worth the investment if you like listening to music while sitting on the porch, backpacking, camping, working in the shop, and etc.

Thank goodness we purchased this speaker on Amazon because it died at barely 13 months and JBL was not going to replace it.  Luckily we read our Amazon page and discovered that we had a 2 year warranty through our Amazon purchase.  JBL was not going to replace the speaker until we brought our Amazon warranty to their attention.  Otherwise, sound quality is very nice, with a slight lag, easy to sync.  Thank you Amazon.
This is an awesome speaker. It has rich sound overall. The bass is quite impressive. Both my wife and I loved it.5/16/19 Update:

VERY DISSAPOINTING! I purposely bought these speakers, two of them, so I could connect both of them to one computer via Bluetooth. I want to keep one into separate rooms close together to each other and have been on able to link them with my computer and each other. They work very well with my android phone in this fashion but not working at all would like to hea I purposely bought these speakers, two of them, so I could connect both of them to one computer via Bluetooth. I want to keep one into separate rooms close together to each other and have been on able to link them with my computer and each other. They work very well with my android phone in this fashion but not working at all  when connected via Bluetooth to my computer. The only reason why I purchased them.
Likes:It's well-built and durable. I've used it it hanging from the showerhead and it seems pretty waterproof, but I haven't submerged it. Battery life is solid.

I have had this product since January.  This is the 2nd speaker that has been sent.  I struggle bad with it just cutting off.  Unless completely connected to the charger as well as cutting off on the charger.  I am a yoga teacher and have been weary of using it in class.  But now starting to travel and teach more I would like to be able to take it with me wherever I go.  I do not trust the speaker at all.  People keep telling me that all Bluetooth speakers do that.  Tho Iv come across many teachers who are satisfied with the speaker they use.  This speaker has been unpredictable since day one.  Even after receiving the second one.  It really bums me out and I do not trust this to take with me and teach.  I would hate to dive people into a deep yoga/ music journey and the it just cuts off on me.

It's a JBL speaker - it's freaken good! What more can I say.Update: so I put it in my oven so that it maximizes the bass, kinda like the same thing as when you put your smartphone in a cup or bowl to increase the bass and loudness... Well anyway I forgot it in the oven and turned my oven to 400... 10 minutes later I go back to open my oven cuz I wanted to leave it open at 400 for the heat .. and there was my JBL baking.. poor thing. But the magic is that it STILL WORKS PERFECTLY :) It didn't even melt at all!! It was hot af but it's just fine!!

Had this for over a year and the battery life is just as great as the first day I got it. So worth the money. I take this everywhere with me. Haven‚Äôt tested out the waterproof-ness of it because I‚Äôm just not brave enough. I‚Äôve been through so many speakers and they all lose battery life so quickly no matter the price. Gets pretty loud I‚Äôve used this by the pool and the beach on vacations and it‚Äôs been loud enough. If youre outside and have a lot of people around you might need to snag another one and link it though

This product is superiority in itself!!!üòé If I could afford to buy three more I would as it has the ability to connect to multiple JBL Flip 4 Bluetooth speakers... I have bought many Bluetooth speakers in the past couple years putting them in different places in my home and outside, but I find that the JBL Flip 4 is the best product in Bluetooth speaker that I have bought so far to date... I use one in front of my TV as a sound bar... I do not have to have an actual soundbar to have surround sound quality with the JBL Flip 4... It is easy and simple and fast connecting to your Bluetooth device!!! This product is power in a 6-inch Bluetooth speaker!!! I highly recommend it to anyone and everyone!!!

I have been happy with my gen 1 clip JBL speaker for about the last 7 years. I thought it was time to upgrade and I was looking around and saw the flip4. I pulled it out the box and instantly connected it to my iphone. The audio quality blew me away. With the 1 sub on each end and the units internal speakers, it really produced some great sounds from a unit that is not much bigger then your hand. I have to say I am excited to buy another one to create the surround sound feature. For under 100$ you really are paying for the best speaker technology has to offer. GReat buy!

Exceptional quality in design, build, and sound. This speaker feels like my Mercedes Benz.  I was shocked to find this level of quality in a sub-hundred dollar bluetooth speaker. Also it was VERY well packaged by JBL. I would say the packaging was as good if not better than an Apple Macbook Pro.  Nice touch.I‚Äôve been using the box it came in to transport it inside my backpack until my daily use nylon case arrives.

I was debating buying a Bose Bluetooth speaker so I did a little research and found a review from someone who had a Bose Bluetooth as well as this JBL Flip 4. He actually rated this one higher, so I decided to give it a try. For almost half the cost, this little JBL bluetooth speaker kicks out some serious sound and some serious bass!! I live in an apartment complex and so I don't need a huge system and this little speaker is perfect! Not only is the sound amazing, the battery lasts for days and you can use it to make phone calls and it also links together with other flip 4s so you can have a true surround sound experience if you have more than one of these speakers. I would definitely recommend the speaker to anyone looking for an affordable yet high quality device

This is my second JBL flip 4.  They may have a battery life expectancy of 2-3 years.  I am a mobile fitness trainer and use mine like crazy.  After 2-3 years, I was only getting through 1-2 workouts before I needed to recharge the battery.  Whereas I can usually go several days on one charge.  This puts out great sound for an outdoor workout without being offensive to others at an area park not involved with the workout.  And waterproof is a great added bonus for trips to the beach or if the rain sets in

Never had any issues with any JBL product. This speaker has great sound quality for its size especially.  Very portable, easy to use. Battery life is fantastic! Very durable‚Äî takes a great beating and takes falls. Had the same product before and lasts a long time.  Also tech support to order new cords is fantastic!!

This unit has great sound for it's size. I'm very pleased with it. I use it when I teach my self-defense/martial arts classes and it fills up the room on just 50%. The bluetooth effortlessly connects and you're up and running in about a minute. Play, pause, skip, volume up, down, etc all work easily off your phone's music player. Your calls and videos you play on your phone have crisp audio, as well.I cannot attest to the waterproof claims, however, as I only use it indoors in a climate controlled environment.

Love it!!! I was looking for a good speaker this summer and especially for the pool. Came across the JBL flip 4 and made the right choice to buy it. Not only is it water proof but it has a great sound quality and battery life. I tested it on the pool submerging it and work perfectly fine after. I usually go a week without charging it and just charge on weekends when i need for the pool. I have to mention that i also bought the Wonderboom along with this speaker and it stopped working after it went in the pool.

We purchased one after seeing positive references to the Flip 4 on every other bluetooth speaker review.  We were so impressed with the Flip 4, we bought a second one.Bottom Line:  A GREAT speaker.  Highly recommend.

This little speaker is a powerhouse. My neighbor was the one who'd mentioned it to me back in early summer of 2019. So, I bought it and am I ever thrilled. It sits in my bike basket or fits nicely in my water bottle holder frame when I am out on the trails. And trust me, people hear me coming long before they even see me at times. And what smiles it brings. I have brought it into the shower or bath. So soothing. Hang it from a cabinet knob in my kitchen for some cooking or cleaning music. Sits out on the deck while I groom my pooch to sounds from my Amazon music app. Goes out to the garden with me, too.  Give it a try. Guaranteed you will love having it around.

l am a mnobile dj and was in need of a new portable speaker, l have powered QSC12s that I use for weddings, but was was looking for something for rehearsals that smaller, lighter and great sound like many of you, I was a little overwhelmed after doing an Amazon search and finding literally tens of thousands of bluetooth options to choose from.
