It's especially frustrating because probably the most important part of the product -- how good it sounds -- is not something you can really evaluate until after you physically have it. So far so good, the packaging from JBL is impressive its self, great design. l havent tried to see how water proof lt is and probably want, but great to know lt is

At this time in my life I do not have internet in my house, I know what do I live in a cave? So I wanted to get a speaker that I can connect my phone too and play music since it is so quiet in my house.  The battery does last a while. I believe I had it playing for about 6 hours and had enough battery to continue to play. I think my phone died before the speaker did.One thing I did notice was when I had music on and then I would receive a phone call the speaker would make this weird noise. I would have to take my phone call off of Bluetooth mode.

I was looking for an outdoor waterproof speaker and had narrowed my choices down to this JBL, the UE Boom 2, or the UE Wonderboom. Based on online reviews, I thought I would likely get one of the UEs, but I went to a local electronics store where all three were on display to listen to them in person. I highly recommend doing that. I watched a bunch of review and comparison videos, but hearing the speakers through a video was nothing alike to hearing them in person. When I listened to both UE products, the audio sounded like it was coming from underwater. It was muffled and lacked clarity on the mids and high tones, but both UE speakers did have good bass. The JBL was incredibly clear and had a great range. In terms of audio quality, it's hard to compare the three speakers - the JBL was that much better. I haven't had the chance to run it from full charge until it dies to test the battery, but I've used it for several hours at a time over the past two weeks and have been happy with its performance. Bluetooth connection was easy and I like having the buttons on the speaker more than I thought I would. Overall, a fantastic speaker. Highly recommended.

Ordered this product in June 2018, it's now January 2019. And the battery can no longer hold its charge longer than 20 minutes. At first it would last for at least 12 hours but now I had to be plugged in to last that long. Also the plug has to be in the exact right spot for it to charge, if you bump it or jostle it in anyway, it stops charging. VERY frustrating.The Good:

The sound of this little speaker is amazing! I listen to Spotify all day connecting my phone with this speaker via Bluetooth (which was as easy as turning on the speaker and selecting the speaker on my Bluetooth devices in my phone) It fills my studio with music without trouble. It has enough power to raise the volume to unnecessary loud levels. I also tested it as a speakerphone and calls were very clear and people listened to me clearly as well. On the down side, the cable it comes with is short (mostly for recharging the speaker than keeping it plugged). It doesn't come with a carrying case although the box is pretty fancy and could be kept as a case. The user manual comes in so many languages that it's hard to figure out but since I had other Bluetooth speakers before I knew what to do.

I have an audio/video rental company and rent out a lot of JBL PRX and QSC equipment. Those are great for filling large venues. This little Flip 4 is great for personal use. This is perfect to bring along to the bedroom, kitchen, and hotel room. It gets plenty loud. It surprising has some deep end to it, but doesn't compare to something like a QSC K8 when it comes to lows. But that is OK because this wasn't meant to be used as a PA. Think of this as a premium personal speaker that you can throw in a bag. Bluetooth has been rock solid on my iPhone 8. The sound so far is warm compared to some cheaper smaller bluetooth speakers I've used. I really like the rubber push button to turn it on and off much better than the plastic toggle buttons used on other speakers. It feels more premium.

The best speaker I have ever purchased. It is so expensive and I am not the kind of person to spend $80 on a speaker, but this is definitely worth your money. The bass is powerful. It‚Äôs great for listening to music but no so much for, for example, watching movies. It is somewhat difficult to understand what people are saying through this speaker, but that‚Äôs not a big deal to me. I have dropped it a few times, taken it to the beach, held it with wet hands, and it is in great condition. After almost a year of having it, it is a definite upgrade from the JBL 3. After almost a year of use with the JBL 3, it crackled and made a rhythmic thumping sound after I raised the volume past a certain point. Would recommend this investment!

I got the teal one for my birthday. I love the color, the sound, my phone connects to it with no problem. But I dropped 2 stars b/c the 12hrs of continuous play is a joke. Mine won‚Äôt even get 5hrs continuous play. So far it hasn‚Äôt been a problem bc I‚Äôm @ home enjoying it but if I ever take it somewhere not even getting half what‚Äôs promised might suck. Better take a battery pk with you or charging cable. Not going to last 12hrs. Still a good speaker but if it dying after less than half that times a problem you might look elsewhere.

I have no idea what happened but I bought these last May and they're about to completely stop working. The sound is not coming out clearly anymore; everytime there's even a small base in the song, the speakers sound like it's banging against a wall. Everytime I skip a song or even choose a song, it skips/scratches part of the song. I can't even remember the last time I've dropped it or the last time it's been around water; and even so they said it was waterproof. Only positive thing about this is that the battery life they advertise is pretty accurate.

I bought a different no-name brand Bluetooth speaker. It was so bad I didn‚Äôt want to use it. The flip4 sounds really good. I prefer it to my Bose Soundlink. The battery surprised me with how long it lasts. I played 4 hours of moderate volume tunes and when I plugged it in to charge, only 1 led was flashing(I think 80% charged). Easy to connect to both my iPhone and laptop. Good range too. I was outside in the woods about 50 paces away and it didn‚Äôt loose connection. I like this speaker a lot.

Significant upgrade from the Aomais Sport (which was also very good and cheap!) The bass and general sound quality is superb, for such a small speaker. It always picks up on the Bluetooth connection with my phone with no hassle. Long battery life: I listen for probably an hour or two every day, and I go several days in between charges. Controls are easy to use. I haven‚Äôt paired it with another JBL speaker yet, but I like that that is an option for a stereo or a synced multi-room experience. I‚Äôm glad I spent a few extra bucks for this one.

This is the best Bluetooth speaker I've owned--and I've gone through many. I'm not an audiophile by any means, but I listen to a lot of different kinds of media on this. Great for a variety of music (even bass which small speakers like this don't tend to do well with), podcasts, and movies on my computer. It's clear, never crackly, and I've never come close to maxing out the volume.Small enough to throw in a bag, and the battery life is so good that I sometimes forget to charge it for upwards of a week.

I would have never thought such good quality sound can be produced by such a small speaker.  This thing really is great.  And the fact that you can pair several of them together (they say up to 100 but to be honest that overkill) is great.  I've got a second one on the way!Quick Update:

I have enjoyed this for about 2 years and now it has stopped working. I'm totally bummed. I've gone back and forth with JBL and unfortunately I think I'm going to have to eat it. I would have expected to get a little more life out of this for the cost. I take care of my things and nothing specifically happened to cause the speaker to malfunction. Great speaker, just doesn't have a long life as stated.

I'm really excited about this!  It sounds really good, although I almost think my 90's computer speakers might still sound better.  This is totally worth it for the bluetooth though.  I'm interested in seeing what the larger model sounds like.  I still can't decide if I like the sea-foam green color.  One thing I wasn't expecting was that it doesn't put out sound in 360 degrees.  It's definitely loudest in the direction of the logo.  I definitely think the money was worth it though!!  I love it so far.

We have the JBL Flip 4 and the Charge 4 that are able to sync together and provide coverage over the whole apartment, so that we can listen to the same thing in the kitchen, in the study, in the living room, in the bathroom or on the deck. Syncing is easy and intuitive, volume control on the secondary speakers is controlled individually, and you can "pause" them without interrupting anyone else's listening. Or, we can individually Bluetooth to a speaker, and listen to different things. Or, we use the speakers to amplify laptop sounds.These are perfect, simple to use, and easy to understand. We are so happy with them!!

Buen tiempo de entrega, un sonido excelente mejor de lo esperado, un amigo tiene una micro de Bose y comparamos y el sonido de UBL es mucho mejor, Bluetooth una vez programado conecta autom√°tico en mi Android. Preferiblemente comprar el bolso para guardar. Compraria otra vez! Recomiendo.

I originally bought this speaker to connect with another JBL Bluetooth speaker, the charge4.Unfortunately, the app on your phone that you need to connect the two to put on either stereo or party mode is pretty much worthless.

All of the reviews that you read of this speaker that say it is great are true. It's nice and compact, water-safe which is just a nice added bonus because I would have bought it even if it weren't, very reliable connects via bluetooth (or you can use a cord if your device is not bluetooth enabled), and it simply puts out a nice, solid, well-rounded sound. LOTS of volume if that's what you want, but it can also play softly if that's what you want. My teen-age son commandeered the first one I bought so I just ordered another for myself. Buy this speaker!

I read a million reviews about portable speakers and it taught me one thing, even the "legit" websites reviewing products are just looking for the click-through income. These JBL portable speakers get all sorts of glowing reviews but it honestly sounds just ok. It works, sounds ok, and is not too expensive, so its ok. I don't regret the purchase. Any review that says that this thing is blasting out crystal clear sound though is just looking to get a few cents from the recommendation.

I bought this unit in discount from the treasure truck. For the price the sound quality, battery life and overall build quality of the Unit is fantastic.  I own a bose soundlink Mini and the bass is a bit better on that unit but it doesn‚Äôt match the JBL in overall flexibility and especially battery life.  I also found myself not wanting to bring the Bose places because it‚Äôs a bit more fragile.I would highly recommend this speaker to anyone looking to have a compact speaker under $100 that you can just turn on and forget about.

We now own 2 of these, and although the sound quality is very good, pairing them is a slog.JBL claims that you can connect dozens of these at once, in stereo mode, and have a party. The reality of it, is that you can only do this from a mobile device, using their horrible app, that almost never even detects the flippin' devices. You can have them connected to your phone, and the app can't find them.

This was a gift for my husband that we have had for awhile now. At first, the sound quality was great. Now, it makes fuzzy sounds at certain volumes. The charge is also pretty crap now. It will say fully charged but then a few minutes of use later it‚Äôll turn off as if it died and then you have to keep it plugged in to use it again. We also haven‚Äôt used it a whole lot either since we‚Äôve gotten it, so it wears out faster than it should. Other than that it has been pretty handy and of decent quality.

I give it five stars and honestly it is very impressive sound for the size and cost. Yes you can crank it up full and distort it. Ive never seen a speaker that you cant.  It says its water proof but Im sure you can flood it out.  The battery seems to last a long time. I havent ran it until it died out. Its has some weight to it for its size but Im guessing thats how they get sound quality, battery life and durability out of it.  I plan on using it in the golf cart and utv.  Seems perfect for that

After about 3 months of using this speaker it stopped holding a charge for more than a few hours and now it won't charge at all.Also, the USB cord also snapped where it goes into the speaker when I was unplugging it not too long after I bought it. I replaced it with a new one from JBL, the exact cord that came with it, so I don't think it's because of the cord.

Good sound. Volume is loud enough for me... I do not listen to music full volume. Don't like that speaker has to be in a certain position to get full sound, but can live with it. Also...noticing that when my son is using his cell phone nearby, music tunes in and out for lengthy periods of time. Not my mp3 player...I suspect bluetooth connectivity. Other than that, really like this speaker. Enjoy it for both indoor and outdoor use. Would recommend buying a case for protection.

As an individual speaker this thing rocks. So I bought two because the manufacturer claims they can do stereo. I was able to make it work about 1 in 5 times I tried. The sound is wonderful in stereo. If their stupid software worked I would give it 10 stars. But alas it doesn't. So now I have $200 worth of speakers that will only do stereo often enough to piss me off when it doesn't the rest of the time. Very frustrated.

This is the best of the 5 bluetooth speakers in my possession. I think it is also the most expensive, but you get what you pay for. The main use for this item is playing music from my bluetooth transmitting device, and it does connect very quickly when I power it up.As far as sound quality, it is what I would expect from JBL. I  currently own consumer as well as professional sound reinforcement speakers from JBL. The Flip 4 exceeded my expectations - considering the price. By the time I want another similar item, maybe the Flip 5 or 6 will be out by then. I can't wait to hear how the future will sound.

I thought I would save some money by getting the JBL vs the Bose. I already have several Bose products, and this was going to an extra speaker for travel, etc.I did like the new features, cool sounds when turning off and on, and when Bluetooth connects, more waterproofing, longer battery life, to name a few.
The JBL Flip4 is an amazing bluetooth portable stereo speaker. The sound is remarkable, really nice depth and base, super clear tunes.Easy to "pair" with Samsung phone and tablet.

The reviews really boasted about this but I found it to be mediocre as far as sound quality goes and is not worth the money I paid for it due to that. You can't even get it up over half way before the sound gets distorted and prior to that the sound quality isn't great anyway.

For whatever reason it like the first one stopped pairing and the power light is blinking blue.. conflicted information on how to solve on the internet. Wish someone  had an answer. These are great otherwise.Updated:

I love the speaker, it always shocks people how loud it can get for the small size. The sound quality is great, the durability is great, it's dropped a few times, and no worries. I recommend you get it. Now, the only things is, sometimes it can lack the depth of sound quality, specifically when I hear what I believe to be a trumpet üé∫ playing on a jazz song, it doesn't sit well with me coming from this type of speaker. It's sort of annoying and I usually end up skipping that song that I like because of. But it's bearable, worth the purchase

Don't spend your money on jbl they selling their speaker very expensive, and the volume almost always under the expectation.I must to admit that speaker is quality and the bass is powerful but it still not my favorite speaker you can buy sony or even a Chinese speaker it will give your more volume.

I have owned this speaker for a year and a few months. I really love this speaker and am surprised it did not last longer. Now it dies after two songs and being fully charged. Really disappointing as I thought I would get at least 3 to 5 years out of this speaker. I had moderate use and did not use it every day - just on weekends and for camping trips. The sound quality is awesome. I wish the battery life was awesome too. I can only get a hour of listen time on it now, if it is plugged in and charging - but still dies while connected to the charger after an hour. Super bummed about it.

I took this to the Virgin islands and I brought it to the beach one day at the end of the day I set on top of the car I got into the car we drove away I forgot it was on top of the car we took a shrimp turn we heard something fall off the top of the car approximately quarter mile down the road I found it had a small dent in it but it works like it's brand new and I love it and I am really glad it's so durable.

This speaker is probably the most durable thing I own. I‚Äôve left it in the rain and the extreme heat, spilled juice on it, and even dropped it from more than five feet out of a moving vehicle. The pictures are from about a year of this use and abuse and there are barely any marks or dents.The volume carries so it‚Äôs great for parties and the work environment. It‚Äôs the perfect size, It fits just in my hand. I even strap it to my backpack when I run or hike and I only  the strap it comes with. This thing is built to last.

Purchased this speaker to play music when we‚Äôre entertaining guests on our deck or in the pool. Took it out of the box, tuned it on, connected it to my iPad, and played the first song I had on my playlist. Sound quality is AMAZING!! It‚Äôs not fully charged when it arrives so I can‚Äôt comment on the battery life. It‚Äôs sturdy, easy to figure out even without reading the instructions, and comes neatly packaged in a reusable magnetic box. I can‚Äôt wait to use it more!!

This product is amazing. I wanted to upgrade from my last speaker the oontz angle 3 and I'm really happy with my decision! Immediately after trying it I could tell the difference in sound quality. There's way more bass and the sound is just better overall. I chose the red because I'm in the Christmas spirit and the vibrant color matches my decor perfectly. Can't wait to show off this speaker to people who visit for the holidays ü§©

Either I got a defective product or they are lieing about the battery, even on full charge this product will last only a few hours ( not even close to 12 hours, is what is advertised on product description) I was going to buy two of them but what's the pointUPDATE: the speaker won't even charge while playing,when I connect the speaker on the charger when I see a single red blinking light ( meaning the speaker is critically low on battery) it will only chrage up to only one solid white battery indicator.

I have been wanting a JBL Flip speaker since June of last year, but couldn't bring myself to spend $120 on something for just me. But once i saw that the price lowered to $80, i couldn't pass it up!! And i'm so glad i chose this over the new BOSE speaker. I have an older BOSE speaker that was purchased in 2013, and this is just as good if not better. Especially considering it's water proof, and smaller in size than my BOSE. I've already recommended this to my friends as well as family members! Can't wait to purchase a second one.

(tldr at the bottom)Before I purchased this speaker I was using a UE Boom, most likely a first generation model. It was nice, and did what I needed it to. But it was getting old and the battery life was non-existent. So! I hopped on Amazon and found this speaker on sale, and I thought why not. When it came in I was very surprised at the overall quality. I've also had a Nose Mini SoundLink Gen 1, and I compare almost all portable speakers to that. This doesn't quite come close to the Bose, but that's okay! This isn't in the same category. For the price, you get an awesome, little speaker that kicks some nice bass (the sides move like a subwoofer!), it has a solid weight to it for a small speaker so it feels premium (which is important for some people), and the connection to your phone along with controlling the speaker is seamless. It has a little rope for attaching it to something, and a rubber cover for the charging port. I haven't tested the water resistance/proofness of the speaker, but it's fine so far after being in the bathroom when I shower!

Don't order this product from any other seller or website. I made that mistake the first time and spent too much on a shoddy knockoff. This one is the real deal and the difference in audio quality and build is obvious. I bring this to work with me on delivery days and my coworkers adore having this speaker around. I like my music loud and it's the perfect combination of volume and portability. The battery tends to run down quickly, like in a couple hours when it's on full volume, but turning it down a bit can conserve the battery life, or I just bring a charger with me. Worth every penny for the joy of music.

Like others, mine has had battery issues and now does not hold a charge at all. I‚Äôve had it about 14 months and use it almost every day so maybe it isn‚Äôt made to last with this amount of use. Something to keep in mind. For $80.00 I think it should have lasted much longer. I wouldn‚Äôt buy it again.

The speaker sounds great, has solid lows mids and highs for a speaker of it's size. Two complaints:1. The "bass radiator" things on the ends are mostly a gimmick but are a huge trap for sand and dirt. Would have been better with a speaker cap over the ends to keep debris out.
My son has a different model. So we knew what to expect.Based on MUDDLED FUDDLED REVIEWS on other speakers I purchased some lesser priced alternatives.

The sound is great!  The two-device system is flawed however.  If my wife is using the speaker, and I am in the house and get a text message, then my phone overrides hers on the speaker.  So one of the phones has to be totally disconnected from the speaker or you end up with a battle of phones.And it doesn't have to be that way.  I have a set of inexpensive bluetooth headphones that handles two devices flawlessly - on those headphones 2 devices can be paired to it at once, and the 2nd NEVER overrides the first.  If I stop the music on the first device, then sound from second can come through.
Didn't work, would turn on then off I charged for hours, made weird nocies, charged for like 3 hours pulled it off the charger it would die when I turned it on

Bought for my daughter. She dropped it in the tub when taking a bath one day. Still works. Has pretty good sound with good bass. Daughter loves the mint color of this one. Plan on getting her the carry case for it soon. Only one thing I can say is iffy. My daughter knocked it off her table (yes she's a bit clumsy) while it was plugged in and the charge cable broke. These use pretty standard cables so we were able to find another one that charges. Overall though, pleased with the quality of this speaker. Trusted brand. Would buy another one.

Nice little speaker when it would stay connected.. bought it for a party and it continuously dropped the Bluetooth connection... down loaded the app for it and that was just a waste of time... tried resetting using the + & > buttons ... tried and he power button reset trick too.... nothing worked... it's a real disappointment... going back

It‚Äôs a very easy to use Bluetooth speaker and I‚Äôve been using it for a week now almost everyday. It‚Äôs high quality and loud one (not super loud but good enough), connects quickly to my phone. Updating its firmware took 30mins but I don‚Äôt mind cause you don‚Äôt need to update it regularly. Enables you to talk through it and you can also connect it to another JBL speaker and sync them to play at the same time. Overall 5/5

We've had this speaker for about a year and a half. Recently the speaker would shut off randomly and make a terrible scratchy noise without warning until it ultimately again shut off.  I contacted jbl about the 1 year warranty and they provided us a few steps that we already tried to remedy this. It's frustrating they wouldn't replace this(I know it's out of the warranty)  because it was never abused or used to its extent and was exclusively used inside in our kitchen. Disappointing and we wont purchase another jbl product. Should have just went with a bose.

I was using this for watching movies in my RV. Sounds great, however lower levels of the movie the audio would cut out. Then when dialog came back the first couple words the audio would be off.There are some "fixes" but they didn't work for me. So if you are planning on watching movies/tv audio I'd say pass. You'll be disappointed.  If listening to music like most, then it's great for the price!

Sooo this thing is pretty much still brand new but I figured I would drop a quick review.  Over all it seems like it will serve its purpose.  Sound quality is ok as long as you don't turn it all the way up.  Bass is ehhh ok.  I have had several better quality speakers for the same price.  Overall not bad but I would not get another one.  As for battery life or how long this thing is going to last I can't say yet.  The blue tooth connectivity is good.

Admittedly, it has been several years since I‚Äôve purchased a Bluetooth speaker so I‚Äôm not up to date with the product space.  I currently have several rooms in our house and garage connected to apple air ports with amplified speakers.  However, I needed something that I could use by our kiddy pool in the back yard so I purchased this speaker.  I am so completely impressed with the quality, sound resolution and portability of this speaker that I‚Äôm rethinking my entire house setup.  I almost can‚Äôt believe the amount of fidelity and bass response of this tiny speaker.  I typically don‚Äôt write product reviews but felt compelled to give credit to JBL for this product.

These Flip 4 speakers are hard to beat for the price. I have bought one for just about every family member. When we get together it is nice to be able to link all the speakers together. Sound it good. Battery life is outstanding. Had two computers setup with one having a 5 speaker setup and I didn't want to disconnect that and put in on the other computer. I had a bluetooth dongle and used that to connect this speaker to the computer. Problem solved.

First I want to say, this speaker WAS phenomenal to me. It sounds great and is practically indestructible.After a couple months in started to not charge as well. It'd take a fairly long time to charge something that only lasted 6 hours. Then it started to only charge when the wire was in a certain way. I think the rubber lid that covers the USB port applies too much pressure to the USB wire while plugged in that it damaged the port on the device after a little while.

Awesome speaker!! Has awesome sound quality, as well as is pretty loud too, and i love that its waterproof! I got this for my rooftop patio bc my previous jawbone speaker was finally crapping out on me and didnt have good sound quality any longer or held a charge... but this new one is awesome I accidentally forgot to grab it the other night when it suddenly started down pouring and for sitting in the rain for 20-30 mins still works awesome and sound quality still awesome!!!!

I waited a month to write this review due to all the negative reviews about it working for a little while then dying, or breaking. Iv used JBL products for a long time and they NEVER let me down! The sound is phenomenal, the color is amazing and the quality is exceptional. I know there are other speakers out there that are a lot cheaper... but JBL brand speaks for itself. Quality is there and customer service is always on point! Just buy it! üíØ

I utilize this speaker in my studio suite that is 135 Square Feet - It gives beautiful sound that isn't weak/echoey as some Bluetooth speakers can be.  The sound is rich and full, it also connects quickly and stays connected all throughout the day with ease.  I love that it can be portable, or stay connected to its power source for use!  I highly recommend this for anyone looking for a great bluetooth speaker with beautiful sound power!

Paired up with a Charge 3 is the ticket, this little speaker cleans it right up for an unreal sound with the deeper base of the Charge 3. Stand alone this little speaker can handle its own nicely and actually a little cleaner than the Charge 3 at lower volumes with plenty of base, paired up you get an unreal experience. I actually like this little speaker on its own better than the Charge 3 in smaller rooms, but the three stands out in larger rooms at medium volumeüòä

This speaker has a really nice, round sound with good highs/lows/mids. It's easily portable and works well with Bluetooth. Took it on a trip and was a big hit by the pool! Can't speak to long use on battery power as use it mostly plugged in when home. Connects easily to Bluetooth and can plug in a device to play without Bluetooth if you like. All-in-all a great speaker and not too expensive for the great sound!

This SHOULD be 5 stars across the board considering it's the size of a pop can and sounds pretty darn good. Not just for the size but good......period. I have one hell of a home theater and while this is nothing compared to that, it sounds as good as a nice 2.1 computer speaker set up BUT not near field. You have to be about 10 ft away from this baby to appreciate it and believe me you WILL. For 75 bucks I can't believe it.

This is the best blue tooth speaker I‚Äôve had. It‚Äôs my forth try. What I love is that it connects every time, I never have to fight with it like I did with the bose.  I was a little tossed up about the sound quality, this has more percussion than the bose but the bose has a fuller mid-range. I decided to go for the percussion because it works & for exercise percussion may be more important anyway. I sure wish I could marry the 2 for sound purposes.

Battery Life sucks. This speaker doesn‚Äôt last 6 hours without being totally dead. This is the second one I‚Äôve purchased and both are the same. If I want to have it running all day I need to have it plugged it... so it kind of defeats the purpose of it being portable.I have 3 cheapo $29.99 Bluetooth portable speakers and they can last 5-7 days even running them 6-8 hours per day.

The JBL Flip 4 is a GREAT speaker!  The sound quality is awesome.  My kids love to take it in the shower so they can switch songs (still scares me a bit, but they do it and it keeps working).  The speaker is sturdy and tough.  It has a nice strap to carry it.  The range is great!  My son listens to stories from my phone.  I can keep my phone with me downstairs while he goes upstairs to listen and play legos.

Honestly I bought this as a Christmas gift for my partner and I was so jealous üòÇ The sound on this speaker is so powerful! I love the vibrant red although I wanted the black one.. it‚Äôs portable, charges quickly and connects with all tablets computer and phones easily. This was one of the best speakers I‚Äôve ever purchased.. it‚Äôs definitely worth every penny! I would advise getting a case for it especially if you work in a hands on field. It can get dirty, and it‚Äôs not a good look on the bright red. Otherwise it‚Äôs amazing! JBL is the best!

This is our third flip we have purchased (one 3 and two 4's). The sound on these are incredible. I wish the 3's and 4's were compatible, but I knew that when I bought them. The stereo sound on two 4's together is fantastic. Better than a older Bose speaker we have. I hope all my neighbors buy these so we can amp-up any party with connecting sound.

Sound is great up until the top 10% of the volume which then gets a tad bit distorted. I do not hate on it for this though seeing as it is relatively small and still manages to sound really good even at 100%. At ~50% volume the battery lasts for 8+ hours in my experience. I have tested the waterproofing out by bringing it into the shower with me for some shower sing alongs and so far no issues. My favorite thing about it though is the Bluetooth range. It is so much better than some of the other speakers I have owned in the past. I can set it down and go anywhere in the house without any issues.

Great sound and size for the Flip 4.  I just bought it and have been using it at the beach all week.  I love that you can hang it, under the beach umbrella for instance.  Just need to pick up a caribiner to clip to stuff.  I was impressed with the sound from the time I turned it on.  Easy to pair with my iPhone and stream any music service I have.  I was debating between the Charge 3 and Flip 4.  I'm glad I picked the Flip because of the more compact size.  I'm sure the Charge is great and likely improved sound due to larger size, but I like this one being a little smaller.

The connectivity of these speakers is awesome. The range is much farther than my JBL3. However, The JBL 3 sounds MUCH better than the JBL 4. The sound is crackly and definitely not as crisp and clear as my JBL 3. Very disappointed. I'm using them for surround sound for a house party, and was really hoping that the sound quality would be as good as the JBL 3. Also, the JBL 4 will not allow my JBL 3 to connect to it for "party mode". Boooooooooo......

The sound quality of this speaker is comparable to my home wired surround sound. Talk about clarity and high bass. I have this speaker in my office and have received compliments on both its looks and the sound. There is no distortion whether it is turned down low or turned up high and blasting. Bluetooth speakers have came a long way in the way they sound. You cannot go wrong with these speakers at all.**UPDATE**. My iPhone 6+ does not automatically pickup this speaker. I am hoping that Apple and JBL soon has a fix as this gets pretty annoying that whenever you get out of range of the speaker you have to go back and re select it.

This is a nice blutooth speaker don't really see a difference from JBL flip 3. Only thing which is different is it has JBL connect plus instead of JBL connect. Which makes this device the odd one out. I don't understand why JBL has done this. Now that all of my friends having a JBL connect I am unable to join in. I think JBL should give an update for all the newly launched products otherwise JBL flip 4 will just be stand alone device.

Recieved product with defect. Afraid the seam that's open will cause the product to no longer be waterproof. Now have to go through exchange process that will take forever. Not happy. Otherwise, love the product and would recommend it to others. Just make sure yours doesn't come with a defect.

I purchased the Flip 4 in January of 2018.  I have been very happy with it until recently when the battery life decreased dramatically.  I will not hold a charge for even 2 hours now which makes it pretty useless.  I have seen numerous other complaints about this same issue in various places online.  Since there does not appear to be an easy way to replace the battery this speaker is, like most electronic devices now, essentially made to be disposable.  I would not recommend this speaker for this reason.

I bought the flip 4 because i was impressed with my brothers flip 3 . It connected with my phone easily has great sound . i am an audiophile and i still can not figure out how JBL gets such great sound out of a cylinder. I believe it has a class D amplifier in it.  I had it setting on a ledge in my bath tub and it rolled and fell in the water . I pulled it out dried it off and it works perfectly . the cylindrical shape makes it prone to rolling. Standing it up straight improves the bass but limits sound stage. plan on buying another one and connecting them .

This is great speaker. Perfect size, not too big not to small - just accurate in my opinion. It is waterproof what is big upgrade versus JBL Flip 3 which was just splash proof. Sound is clear with just right amount of bass. It also have voice assistant integration feature. Very easy to pair with your phone and if you have more then one (or some of your friends brought another one) you can connect them together for even better music experience. It comes in 9 different colors you can chose from. I highly recommend it, not only to take your music with you wherever you go but also for listing at home. Total worth money I have spend on it.

Very impressed with the sound.  I was on the fence about whether to get this or the Charge 3.  Video reviews of the sound seemed accurate in that the Charge 3 delivers better bass but is otherwise murky.  And even though I like full sound with bass, I think the Flip 4 is the better option for music lovers who value tones.  I'd say the bass out of this is "enough" to satisfy.  It's also smaller and more portable, which I like.  If I travel, it won't take up much room in a suitcase.The BT range is very good, as expected. It pairs easily.  I like that the sound is very good no matter how you place or stand it. Battery life seems excellent though I haven't run it for more than a couple of hours at a time. I haven't tested its water handling abilities (and probably won't, it wasn't a factor in my decision)

I really like the look of the speaker and the sound is really good! It connects to the bluetooth, in my laptop, every single time. I bought a few of them. The problem I have with them is, they don't stay connected to each other when I daisy chain them. I have tried many, many times. Occasionally, they will stay connected for a little while but most of the time they don't. But as I said, the sound is really good.

Excellent sound for a small lightweight speaker. I have other speakers like the sony srx which is way better but heavier this one im very impressed and this i take on my hikes bike rides cabin trips.Advice to buyers dont think try it dont get too technical enjoy the sound and easy connection and amazing battery life (mine lasted 4 days of listening (3pm to 9pm) intermittently and even now there are two bars left.

This is my second one, I had the 3 and it lasted about 4 years and it finally peter'd out (it works for about 20 minutes or so and then it dies so I just go the JBL 4 and I couldn't be happier with the slightly larger size and the sound is amazing.I just wished that Amazon notified me that it was coming a day earlier and rang my door bell to inform me that my expensive item was left sitting on my front porch without me knowing about it?  Otherwise, I am happy with this brand and this item.

I really love this speaker. It is relativly light and has an easy transportable size. There is a handy string connected to the back which can be used to hang up the speaker. Charges quickly (about an hour for fully charged) and lasts for a while depending on what volume you keep it set at. The sound quality is really really great and its actually kind of fun to watch the bass vibrating on either side of the speaker which does not distort the sound at all. The packaging was simple and easy to open. I have not tested if it is waterproof yet. One small point is that the speaker and inner packaging was sort of warm upon arrival, almost like the battery had heated it up. This may have been related to the delivery but worth mentioning. I 100% would recommend this speaker to anybody who needs a light durable bluetooth great quality sound system. Love this speaker.

I love this speaker!  My husband gave this to me as a gift for my birthday.  I take it everywhere and the color is super cute.  The outer portion is plastic except for the area that covers the speaker.  Unfortunately, we have 4 kids and someone's dirty hands (with brownie crumbs) touched it and it's very noticeable.  Still works great, of course!  If you have little ones or any person around you with potentially dirty hands, be warned.  Ha!  May want to get the black instead. :)If you appreciated this review and if you enjoy other great deals, you can follow me on IG @prettycheapmama!

I spent lots of time reading reviews and weighing the pros and cons of the $100 Bluetooth speakers market. I settled on the JBL Flip 4 in early summer, and it was a great decision! Like stated in the product description the battery life is phenomenal. I generally don't listen on more than half volume and I'll go weeks without charging. The design is sleek and functional, and its small size means you can bring it everywhere and put it anywhere. The sound is very good in all varieties of of music, I listen to rap, country, rock, jazz, big band, choir, really anything sounds great. I really like the red color, it pops in every environment so you won't forget it on the beach or on a rock by your camp fire. Fantastic speaker for its price and size!

Let me tell the epic tale.First, word of advise from the wise, when you take this gem of a speaker on a float trip, you must attach it to a life jacket or some sort of floatation accessory. You won‚Äôt be sorry.

This speaker has a very poor connection for charging, the original cable does not work well at all, if it moves slightly it will not be charging. You always have to wiggle it to get it charging again. If it is not charging, the battery will run out very quickly, you have less than 30-40 mins before it will die because the battery is not sufficient for the speaker. I will never buy another JBL product.

I‚Äôm so pleased I took a punt on this little speaker. I have a big old Beats boombox that I was using but carrying it from room to room was a pain. So that is now staying in my garage gym because this little speaker is just what I needed. It‚Äôs actually louder than I expected it to be, sound quality is great and the battery life is good considering I use it several hours a day. I‚Äôm only charging it once a week just now. I haven‚Äôt had any problems connecting it to my iPhones following the original syncing. For the price I am super happy.

Great device with good sound.  But if you want to watch videos and use the Flip 4 for the audio, it WILL NOT SYNC BY BLUETOOTH.  The sounds is delayed.I spoke with all levels of JBL support and they all said the same thing.  Their wireless speakers, ALL OF THEM, are designed to listen to music.  NONE OF THEIR WIRELESS SPEAKERS WILL BLUETOOTH SYNC WITH VIDEO.  If you want to watch a video and have the sound sync, you have to connect mini stereo jack (so old school).

Just got this guy today, so giving a review based on initial impressions. Will update if there are any issues. Perfect size. Compact enough to be thrown in a bag or even carried in hand, but big enough to have some solid base and sound. It feels sturdy and had some nice packaging.  It connected with my phone and laptop pretty much instantly. None of that bluetooth bs. So far I'm very happy with it. My only gripe is that it only comes with a charging wire and not the plug.

I use this everyday to listen to audiobooks and sometimes music on my way to work, while at work, and in my garage at home.  I have had it about 4 1/2 months now.  I charge it every 2 or 3 days.  Battery life is excellent at 10-12 hours on a full charge, depending on volume.  I like that the cylinder shape fits in the cupholder of my car.  It has  suprisingly good bass for it's size.  I have no complaints about the purchase.

(yet another self-proclaimed) Audiophile here. I've been using this for several months and I'm still in disbelief in the range and quality this tiny equipment outputs. I have several speakers, many larger and some with wooden cases. This can easily hold it's own against speakers more than triple its size and price. It blows my mind how the engineers at JBL achieved this. The bass hits hard and deep and mids are clean and crisp. The gigantic cherry on top is how small and portable it is. I never pack my suitcase without it. Oh yeah, did you read it's waterproof too?

For context, it's 01:06, and my house may smell as if a skunk peeked in for a minute.While enjoying a midnight snack and listening to "Strawberry Fields Forever" from the [i]Across the Universe[i] film soundtrack. Everything was sounding great, and then I heard a bullet. It may have been artificial, but I swear, I heard a friggin' bullet. I was half a gulp from choking at the jump-scare.

Great speaker for the price. Gets very loud, I usually play it at half volume or less. Very little sound distortion. Will try to update review once I‚Äôve tried the waterproof feature and get a better idea for the battery life.Edit: battery life is at least 5 hours. Ran it for just more than a 5 hour grad party. Definitely very waterproof. I use it in the shower all the time, but I‚Äôve never submerged it.

My son had bought one of these little speakers and he loves it. Well I decided to purchase one and I am very happy. For a small speaker it has great sound. I only listen to jazz and I never listen to loud music. My wife loves Motown, that's what we grew up on. Well she listens to Motown when she does her daily workouts and she decided to crane up the sound. This little speaker even sounds good when the volume is all the way up. Another plus is the ability to hold a charge and it's waterproof. We took this out on our canoe and it was playing for over 4 hours, that evening I listen to it for another 5 hours and it was still going strong.

I have a JBL charge 2 that i got 4 years ago, and its battery isn't lasting like it used to, so my husband surprised me with this speaker for Christmas and i was apprehensive at first. I am really blown away by my how great this speaker was compared to my charge 2. The only thing i would change is didnt include a wall adapter to the charging cord. So its stuck with USB only.  The sound quality is amazing and i didnt have to blast it (i like loud music) and my beloved charge 2 now sits in retirement on the shelf

I ordered 2, but one is malfunctioning - less than a week after the return window.  I have only used them a handful of times, and as I used them, one started to make crackling noises.  At first, it was just after it connected to my phone and the other speaker.  Just a slight crackling for a second or two.  My last use, it crackled more than it didn‚Äôt, even drowning out the other speaker.  Very disappointed.

It never fails... This was my best new little friend.  It packed amazing sound and it was so small until on day the stupid thing decided never to turn on again.  hate wasting money and I knew I should have just gone to best buy but I took a chance.  I was reluctant to trash it but after 5 days I couldn't get it to come back on.  That's the only problem with buying electronics on Amazon...They can stop working after your 30 days return window is over.

The Flip 4s are great for using them in multiple rooms or outside. I was contemplating the purchase of a flip 5 but the flip 5 is not compatible with the flip 4 in a multi-speaker environment. Sorry JBL, you messed up  here.

Pretty decent speaker except...  something may be wrong with the speaker's battery and charge that it can hold.I was really enjoying the bluetooth feature until the speaker cannot hold the charge for more than 10-15 minutes.

Bought this speaker about a month ago, been using it daily since then.. After walking into multiple stores I concluded that this was the best BT speaker for the price and I've been really happy with my decision!I take this bad boy everywhere, in the shower, kitchen while I'm cooking.. I love how small and light it is, bought a case for 10$ and it's perfect. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a portable speaker in the 80-90$ price range as this speaker is easily better quality than most of the 130$+ portables out there. 10/10 no complaints yet!

I bought this speaker February 8, 2018. It sounded great, but a week ago it stopped taking a charge. I have tried all kinds of things, and tested all the possible USB chargers to make sure that it was not the chargers. The unit just does not charge at all. Very dissappointed and surprised for this product to have failed because it is made by JBL, but apparently several other reviewers have exprerienced the same problem. I would not recommend buying this until jBL resolves the problem.

Very upsetting that this speaker purchased for a Christmas gift 7 months ago is now non functional.  All of a sudden the volume buttons don't work on the speaker, and have a mind of their own, changing volume on their whim.  Son is extremely upset.

This speaker is awesome. It's my first JBL and I've had it for over a month now. Battery life is great, the sound is great even with heavy base. Music has a nice full sound and it can get very loud. I also  listen to a lot of audio books and this speaker makes it much easier to hear while moving from room to room and voices are not distorted. I love that there is the potential to sync with other JBL speakers.My one con isn't even a serious one. I don't think it has the connection range that I heard claimed on some YouTube reviews. I took my phone across the house (I live in small home so it wasn't that far) and the speaker cut out a bit.

Nice contact portable Bluetooth speaker. Apparently, you can pair it with other compatible jbl speaker to extend the range.I was disappointed that it doesn't have a good way to stand it. It doesn't really game a base. It's completely round. I've been standing on its end which is cantilevered and doesn't stand perpendicular. The bass drivers are out the ends of the tube so standing it this way drives the bass into the shelf and the other end into open air.

This is my second one of these devices, and they both perform exceptionally well. I have one for my office and one for travel purposes. The sound is rich and clear, and the Bluetooth connectivity is perfect. You‚Äôll be amazed at the quality of sound one can get from these small speakers. They are amazing. Plus, the charge lasts a long time, and charging is easy with the USB plug in.

Should have written a review of this months ago. I bought this because it was water proof and I like to have it with me on the golf course. It is well made and tough and the sound quality and amplification is great. Fits in the cup holder of a golf cart. Battery lasts at least 5 hours with conituing play. I liked the one I bought for my golf bag so much I bought another one for my office. My friends like it so much 5 of them have bought one for themselves. JBL has always been recognized as a quality speaker manufacture, this lives up to the legend. As good as a Bose mini ant less than half the price. You will not be disappointed.

If I can give this piece of garbage zero stars I absolutely would! I came back home today to my package, I had ordered a JBL flip 4 color teal and received a black jbl which was fine, I actually didn‚Äôt mind the color after wards. However, the more and more I messed with it the speaker looked USED! It had stains and did not look brand new!!! Not only was the speaker horrible but it did not even come with the right charger! Looks like someone just replaced it with the original speaker and just threw it in the box along with a dirty charger. I will definitely be requesting for a refund. This is just freaking ridiculous.

Tried 2 other speakers and found them wanting especially as regards sound quality.  Bought this 6 months ago and am still surprised at the sound quality and long battery life.  It's not going to handle the needs of a wedding reception but it's plenty powerful enough for a porch full of people.  Remarkable and clear bass even at low levels.  It's just a really good wireless speaker and well worth the money.

During a Kayaking trip with some friends i tied this off to the bow lashings so i could paddle and listen to music. until i flipped the kayak and all my gear was submerged for at least 10 minutes. and when i finally righted the boat, the speaker was STILL PLAYING. I'm blown away at how wel the design prevents water damage, the sound quality is just what you'd expect if not more. just use the charger it comes with, or the microUSB's from Amazon Basics, and you'll enjoy this product for years.

I wanted a Bose speaker, but the waterproof version did not stand up to the Bose sound standard in my opinion. This JBL Flip 4 isn't up to the Bose sound standard either, but is not only adequate for the intended use, but better sounding than the waterproof Bose speaker. Easy to use and carry. Quick to connect to bluetooth. I really like how well it works with my phone. Long battery life.

I love it!  I used to have a portable Bluetooth speaker and it died.  I saw a close friend had this.. and it got really loud, really quickly..and still had a pristine sound.  I didn't think about it at the time, but when mine died, I asked him about it.. and he suggested I get it.  I absolutely love mine.  Easily transportable, waterproof - which is great because I'm constantly near the water, and the sound is unbeatable.  Great purchase!

I always wanted speakers for better sound and volume for parties. I went for this one because it is louder and wireless as compared to Google Home mini. Also a much better base as compared to google home mini. I was for some reason experiencing audio delay in google home mini and i don't in these speakers maybe because of bluetooth versions. Honestly I love the product, giving it 4 because I wish these were little bit cheaper.

Wonderful little speaker. I wasn‚Äôt intending on buying but when cyber Monday came around the price was so good for this little speaker, I had to go for it. It came as promised, I had heard the sound of this speaker before and was very pleased. It fills a room very nicely, I had also bought a bike mount and will use it come spring time. Of the price comes backs down again I‚Äôll pick up a second cause the speaker has a party mode to link many of them together.

Excellent! So far so good. Deeper bass notes a low to 80% volume. But, unfortunately like the original Flip 3. It decreases bass response as volume is turned up to maximum...But, overall very good. Will update regarding longevity as time goes on...As for the seller. Item was delivered in a timely manner, and in good order...

Was hesitant to purchase this speaker as I appreciate sound quality over loudness and tend to not be a bandwagon fan. I own several speakers from budget friendly to high end (audiophile). I can say that this little speaker impressed me with it's portability and decent audio. (Not the best, and above average in the mids and highs, Bass was good.) Overall satisfied and do recommend. I am a fan of Sony and chose this one over the SRS-XB20.

These speakers are awesome. I usually listen to them for 10-20 mi utes in the morning and while i shower at night. I can get at least 8-10 days out of them on a charge with that routine.  Purchased two and setting them up for the right and left speaker stereo use is a breeze with the JBL app. The JBL app does take up quite a bit of space....but that's my only complaint with that side of things. These speakers look and feel of great quality and the sound itself is exceptional. Definitely better than I expected in all aspects.
I bought this speaker twice now. One for myself, and most recently as a gift. it is well loved!Primarily use it on our kayaks or by the pool. the splashproof feature is what sold me on it.

I‚Äôm very happy with this little speaker. If money was no object then I probably would have gotten a Bose, which would have been a mistake. Bose is great, but for a fraction of the price this JBL has great sound with surprisingly good bass. And the fact that it costs a lot less makes me less afraid to take it to the beach or park or camping; I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôd do that with a $300+ Bose speaker.

It worked for about 5 minutes then turn off. So I charged it. Now it won‚Äôt turn on at all. I looked on the internet and found that if you plug it in and immediately unplug it the power will come back on, however now it won‚Äôt connect, and the only way to turn off the power is to plug it in and unplug it right away. There were several complaints of the same thing when I looked it up.

This speaker is amazing!!! When I first saw the Flip 4, I never thought that it would deliver such a powerful, rich sound. I knew that it would be pretty good when I ordered it, but I never thought that it would be as good as it actually is. This speaker is most powerful with midrange and lower sounds. It delivers smooth, deep bass. The higher sounds can be a little tinny when at full volume, but normally having it at half or even 1/4 volume is plenty enough to be heard across multiple rooms. The waterproof aspect is a nice touch too, I haven't submerged it yet, but it has been through some steam, and can be used as a shower stereo. The charging port and auxiliary connection jack are sealed away nicely with a seemingly water-tight rubber flap (again, I have not yet submerged it, so I am not 100% sure on any of the water proofing features).  The Bluetooth is fairly average, but it connects quickly with my outdated android. Overall, this is a great speaker for an even better price.

First of all the sounds great but all that is pointless when you have instructions that are about 15% in English . No lie i thought it was a different book for Spanish & Japanese customers. Theres no way of finding hes dead. No way of starting up, troubleshooting & general descriptions . I was in awe. But my question is why do i hear loud thumps from inside speaker when its turned up real loud & you lower or increase volume !

I love the JBL Flip 4 because it provides incredible sound quality in a small, compact package at a far lower price than competing models from companies like Bose. I have one Flip 4 in the corner of my kitchen, and it puts out great, powerful sound. I also love the JBL Connect + feature because it just works and it works well to link multiple speakers together with no issues. Finally, the Flip 4 looks and feels like a far more expensive product compared to the terrific prices it sells for here on Amazon.

Got this speaker less than a year ago. I work in a truck 10 hours a day 5 days a week, there‚Äôs no radio so I bring this to use daily. Initially I was very pleased, great sound quality. The first thing I didn‚Äôt like very much was the battery life. They exaggerate heavily on what your actually going to get out of it when your listening to it at a decent volume. I was able to overlook this due to the great sound. Ok so nine months later this thing does not hold a charge at all, I can charge it fully and it will be dead in a matter of 30 mins. Just horrendous battery life not even usable less than a year after the purchase. If you want a speaker that‚Äôs actually going to last you look elsewhere

I spent quite a bit of time researching different Bluetooth speakers before settling on the the one I wanted. The best & most thorough reviews I've seen are by JimsReviewRoom on YouTube. The guy knows his stuff and it's apparent that he spends countless hours going over each and every detail of the products he reviews and what they're best suited for. I watched every Bluetooth speaker review he has so I was in doubt when I chose the Flip4 and I love it!

I LOVE this little guy. My cousins have the black one and we're always borrowing it but I needed one of my own for beach/fishing trip days... Naturally, I googled what the best bluetooth speakers were out right now and the JBL Flip 4 was listed. I was thrilled when I came across a camo version!! I haven't fully submerged it into water, and I don't suggest anyone does that lol, but it held up just fine through rain on the boat for several hours. Can't say much about the battery life yet, no issues so far.

I convinced myself to buy a cheaper bluetooth speaker but decided to splurge on the flip 4 and I'm very happy I did.  I know cheap speakers have come a long ways, but this guy sounds excellent for its size, is water resistant and tough.  I've dropped it a bunch, its gotten rained on and it keeps on going.  Good battery life overall and the bass response is surprising for its size.  Overall I think its a great speaker and I'm super happy I invested a little more than I was planning in it.

This speaker is the best! It links to the Bluetooth device super quick and easy, waterproof, really durable and very high quality sound. The sound is by far the best quality I've seen from any portable speaker, another cool feature is they will link to other Flips so if you have a friend with one or you buy another one it will all link together and play! It's a no brainer if you're on the fence, I spent weeks researching and I'm glad i decided on this speaker. Hope this helps, Cheers

this is by far one of the most flawless pieces of technology i‚Äôve ever bought. i love this thing. i‚Äôm coming back to this page a year after i bought it to remark on how good of a product it is. just a delight to use. bravo to the people who built it. sounds incredible. the side woofers are amazing. so portable. the industrial design is slick. every part of it feels like quality. they really nailed it. the only regret with this thing is when i don‚Äôt have it with me

Ordered this and arrived on time.  Battery would not hold charge.  Called Amazon and they connected me with the company and sent it in for replacement.  Replacement was defective too, as the 5 light indicators for charge would not all light-up.  Only 4 lights would be on.  I think the problem was the defective light.  Everything else worked fine though.  Sent that in and waiting for another to be sent, hopefully this one is not defective.  I moved away from Bose as more and more of their products failed me and they were incredibly stingy with replacement and so far quality is failing me with JBL.

I bought this speaker through the seller REFERENCE HK LIMITED - It was close to a year ago now and I don't have any of the original packaging, but thinking of it I'm not sure that it was shipped in manufacturer packaging. I bought it as a replacement for another JBL speaker (the clip 2) and was surprised that it seemed to me that it had slightly lower quality, but i wasnt feeling picky. Just now, I was having connectivity issues with the micro usb charging port, and decided to open it up to see if i could throw in a replacement. I peeled back the grille and first of all, this is clearly not a waterproof speaker. Second, After doing some research, I cannot find any other jbl speakers that have similar structure to this one. I know that slightly different products are shipped to different countries sometimes, but this looks completely different than anything that I can find online

Love this speaker. I‚Äôm not a speaker enthusiast. If you want something that is clear and has good volume output, get this. I use it for when I‚Äôm cleaning around the house, cooking, or working outside in the yard or on my vehicle. Holds a charge well and lasts decently long depending on how loud you play music. I have not tested out the waterproof feature other than it was outside during a light rain. Do not get white unless you feel like you can keep it clean and grease free. That was my only mistake.

Love this speaker, the sound is crisp and loud! I purchased the white one (Bad idea, as it gets dirty easily) but regardless of that, the sound is great, battery life is surprisingly long! I bought to use it later this year while I am on my honeymoon, so, I have no yet tested its resistance with water, even though I will be kept at a chair while at the beach. So far, I enjoy this product, i definitely recommend it.

For a device about the size of a 16 oz beer can, this has very good sound.  Is it a replacement for high quality speakers as some have said? Not even close!  But I don't think it is reasonable to expect that from a device of this size.  Part of my reason for selecting this particular model was for use as a hand free speaker when I work in remote, mobile offices.  This thing excels in that role.  With a group of people in the room, 8-10' away, they can speak in a normal voice and is very clear to the person on the other end.  It also does a good job of canceling back ground noise.
My JBL Flip 4 randomly shuts off while playing music.  Research has indicated this is a bug/poorly implemented feature.  Kind of a pain in the neck.  Otherwise, this would be a great little speaker.

I love the JBL Flip. This is my second Flip 4, the first one rattled after a hard fall, so I decided to get this to replace it. The speaker sounds great, and when they are new the battery life is good; however, this speaker was barely over a year old when the battery started to not hold a charge any longer. It would show that it was fully charged, but after about an hour of use it would die. It‚Äôs obviously an issue with the battery. I went ahead and just bought another one, but I feel like they should last longer.

Easily the best product I bought this year. Sometimes you just have to treat yourself, and boy was this a way to do it :) The Flip 4 blows the Flip 2 out of the waters (my old speaker). Great sound. Sexy color. Professional service and prompt delivery! Worth every penny!!
Great sound. Its a good balance between price and sound quality. Best value!I like this speaker so much I bought a second one.

This speaker lasted one year and five days which is now over its one year warranty.  I contacted their support via e-mail and still don't have a reply back from them after several days.  I will never buy another JBL product again.

I bought a Flip 4 speaker about a year ago, and was delighted with the sound quality.  So a couple of months ago I bought another Flip 4 speaker so that I could listen via stereo.  The JBL literature advertised that you could connect up to 100 speakers from the same source or use 2 speakers in stereo mode.  After spending a few hours experimenting and talking to customer service, I was finally told that stereo mode ONLY works via the mobile app.  Stereo mode does NOT work via a MacBook Pro.  If you are only interested in using one speaker in mono mode, this is a good product.  However, if you want to use this product in stereo via your computer--it will NOT work.  JBL's reputation just took a huge drop in my eyes.

The speaker is excellent. I used two, paired in stereo, with a Fire tv. First I tried connecting one speaker to the tv by Bluetooth and then linked the two speakers using JBL Connect app. This resulted in intermittent static which went away when I connected the first Flip to the tv with a cable. I then connected the 2nd Flip to the 1st with JBL Connect app. This cleared the static but the app isn‚Äôt reliable. It switches off stereo sound without warning. If you are buying one it‚Äôs a good product. If you are hoping for reliable stereo (which is excellent when functioning) there must be a better product. I returned mine. Great hardware is undermined by JBL‚Äôs unreliable  software.

After trying google home, amazon echo and  bose soundlink II, finally I found the perfect speaker that sounds great and normal easily connects to Bluetooth and has auxiliary connection as well. Have not tested the battery yet since I do not have to take it anywhere and have it always plugged in. Do not know how long the speaker last sine I just got it.

I absolutely love my JBL!! It is definitely waterproof üòä ü§™ lol the only reason I took a star off is because I thought it would be louder...it is decent I just excepted a little bit more from JBL on this one...still great buy though. The battery lasted me all day playing tunes...at least 4-5 hours straight. When water gets in it, you go need to shake out the droplets because it causes the volume to be even lower...pairs easily with my iPhone (haven‚Äôt tried any other device pairings) All the functions are simple to use. All in all can‚Äôt go wrong with quality and sound..volume is decent (would still buy it again)

What a great little speaker!  Unfortunately, the controls on the box are so well blended into the camouflage background, that you can't see them, so it's difficult to adjust unless you really know the instrument.  Since I use this in a guest house, there is a lot of explaining how to use it.  Could use a direction paper or booklet to explain operation.

I bought the JBL flip 4 based upon my trust in JBL products and the mostly favorable reviews.  I am an old school big speaker person, but for my new kayaking hobby, I needed something waterproof and compact. I am very pleased, it pumps out a lot of sound, the battery is  more than adequate and it is unaffected by water. It is very simple to connect via Bluetooth.  I bought the teal colored model to match my kayak...Very happy with the JBL flip 4.
Compar√© precios y la verdad fue el mejor que encontr√©, super funcional, sonido excelente, buenos bajos y compatible con todos mis aparatos electr√≥nicos bluetooth, 100% recomendado

Great sound from JBL portable relatively small speaker! I don't know how they pack the live bass, excellent mid-range and high register sound into such a small portable speaker, but JBL does in this Flip4. This is the 3d one I've purchased for myself, my son and now my brother. At $99 it was a good value. At $75 it was an outstanding sound value. Buy it.

Incredibly disappointed with this purchase. We bought this speaker to use at the lake this summer so even though it was bought in February we didn‚Äôt actually go to use until this weekend (Memorial Day weekend). The blue tooth wouldn‚Äôt connect to some of our devices so I followed instructions to do a hard reset. Unfortunately the system wouldn‚Äôt turn on at all after that. It will charge just fine and lights up when on the charger. As soon as you take it off the charger it won‚Äôt power on.I watched a YouTube video on what might be the problem. As I got inside the speaker it was obvious this had been previously tampered with. Parts were duct taped together and there was a small piece of paper  floating around within the guts of the system. At this point I can only assume this is a refurbished model so likely the battery or mother board is fried.

Had the flip 3 before this, and the flip 4 is slightly larger but also puts down slightly more power as well. Use this thing every day at work and battery lasts multiple days in a row before charging. I prefer quality over loudness/outright bass and this definitely has good clarity and punch. Gets a bit dry and crunchy sounding as the volume goes up past a certain point. Am a huge fan of JBL speakers.

The only reason I‚Äôm giving this four stars is the sound and connectivity is really good,  the only issue is the whole ‚Äú water proof‚Äù part of it?? What does this mean exactly? Yes it did take a drink in a river and now it won‚Äôt power up, yes it was submerged in water few a minute maybe. Be very careful that yours doesn‚Äôt take a dunk into the toilet or any water. Other than that it‚Äôs a great speaker!

This is the one you want. The speaker is powerful enough to make conversation difficult in my kitchen, and it's indispensable camping gear. Surprisingly good bass response for such a small speaker. Battery life is good. I don't know exactly how many hours you get out of it, but I use it for many days between charges. Pairing devices via blue tooth is a breeze. Spring for the carrying case; you'll be glad you did.

Really impressive. I was going to buy my husband a more expensive Bose speaker but the reviews on this made me change my mind. The reviews were right! It‚Äôs really great sound quality. Easy to use and connect. Used it in the shower even. There is bass vibrations at both ends that really round out the sound. Trust the reviews. They are all right!

Looks like there are major issues with this product after looking at online reviews.  Failure to power due to internal disconnection of components.  I guess I could take it apart and repair, like a lot of other people have had to do, but  not interested in having to do that with a product I just purchased.Got a replacement --- worked for a short time and then same thing.  Does not charge or power up.

After 6 months of owning this, I'm still impressed. The sound quality and humidity resistance are top notch. I tried the more expensive market leader in sound devices prior to this purchase and the JBL is better sound for a fraction of the price. The battery life continues to amaze me. I use it regularly throughout the week for audiobooks, music, and streaming Netflix, yet have only had to charge it every 4-5 weeks (seriously, whaaaat?!). This was a great investment.

This is the 3rd Flip I have purchased and all have the same issue, eventually. The unit will stop charging because of the connection port, at about a year. SO I bought the extended warranty this time for $2.95 and that is the way to go. For the price, this is the best product I can find and it does rock. ONLY if you could put these speakers in series.

This speaker worked amazing in the beginning. It was used for my classroom. It was loud, connected to my Bluetooth instantly. There were absolutely no complaints from me at all. Until 3 months later, it stopped working randomly. I mean literally, one day it was doing its thang and the next day when I went to go use it, it didn‚Äôt work. I immediately came to the review section of the speaker to see if I‚Äôm just going crazy. And apparently this happened to so many people where it just stopped working with no apparent reason. So 5/5 for the first couple months. Definitely a 0/5 because it won‚Äôt last long

I have always liked JBL.  Great bluetooth  connectivity I was able to walk away from the speaker with my phone probably a good 75-80 feet and still didn't lose signal.  The only bad part is, they most rate the 12 hours of battery life at a very low volume..  I have tested it the last few days.  I got about 6 to 7 hours out of this speaker with the volume just over half way on my phone.  The speaker is loud..  Just wish the battery lasted longer.

This thing is great!  I am picky about sound quality but also spend a lot of time outdoors at our house on the water. This is a very good solution to get very decent sound in a small device with weather resistance. Easy to pair with blue tooth. Several members of the family have paired it and it sticks, although they may have to reconnect, but it shows up on their iPhone for example.  Well made, good sounding easy to use.

This isn't a computer generated or paid review. Searched for a week for a bluetooth speaker that could go outdoors, was at least splash resistant (This one claims to be waterproof, I don't wanna test that out lol) and had decent db/watts. Read many reviews and decided on JBL. So far, this speaker has it all. Just got it today and tested it out. Sounds great, the high end sounds wonderful and the low end is fantastic. Seems pretty rugged and durable. Not sure how well the battery life is yet, but I should be able to get a few hours out of it at full volume. I would recommend if you this is in your price range. I'll update if there are any issues. But so far, so good.
Figuring I needed an upgrade from the

Physically the size and shape are good, although it is rounded on the bottom for some reason. Pairing was quick and easy with a Android phone. I am not impressed with the sound. I've been a JBL fan for years, but this speaker sounds mushy. No distinct highs and lows. Maybe it's the type of music I play on it(mostly rock), I don't know. It is definitely better than my phone speaker, but still far below even basic bookshelf speakers. On sound alone I'd give it a 3.

When I used my speaker I charged it for a full 12 hours the night before my daughter had a volleyball tournament and the next day she used it for about thirty minutes and it died. Charged it again for one of her practices died within thirty minutes as well I don't know if this is common or if it's my outlet but I won't ever buy from JBL ever again this was a waste of my money. Also, the Bluetooth was decent it would come unconnected and make my phone start to glitch. Even when it wasn't connected to the speaker.

I bought this speaker just over 3 months ago.  I used it every day for the first 3 weeks or so then not at all until the last couple days.  When I was first using it the battery would last at least 12 hours if not more.  After its last use I fully charged it, unplugged it, and set the speaker aside.  After a month and a half or so I picked it up and turned it on.  After 3 1/2 hours it was dead, i figured it lost some of its charge because it had been sitting unused for a while.  I let it charge over night and the next day same thing, 3 1/2 hours and the battery is dead. I like the speaker, it sounds great, but I'm disappointed with the battery life.EDIT: I found an article explaining the battery life issue.  The speaker was tested at MAX volume and lasted 4 hours but when tested between 50% - 75% it hit the 12 hour mark.  I personally think that if you advertise a 12 hour battery life it better be 12 hours at max performance!

It keeps disconnecting when I have two of the same paired with the JBL app. It‚Äôs frustrating. The sound quality is decent though. Loud enough for a regular bedroom. I wish it had more battery as well.

Although, there were less expensive speakers with good reviews, I‚Äôm extremely pleased with my JBL Flip 4 Speaker, which also had great reviews!The sound quality is amazing! It‚Äôs so loud, I have to turn it down sometimes!  I usually keep it in my car, so I keep it charged all the time not allowing the battery to diminish. So, I can give an observation about the battery life. However, everything else is fantastic!
NEGATIVES:1. Am angry and disappointed that the bluetooth function on this speaker has died after only 9 mos. of

I gave this product 3 stars because after 1 year and half , the battery life is next to nothing. I have to charge it daily just to listen to it for a few hours every other day. It is very annoying for your ‚ÄúBluetooth‚Äù speaker to always need a charge while you are playing it. It also does NOT charge while you are listening to music. If it is dead then you have to wait for a full charge before listening again.

I have owned this speaker for ten minutes so I can‚Äôt comment on the battery life. I can say that at less than half volume Al Green is happening! I‚Äôm not a techie, but for my ear the balance is perfect, Al‚Äôs high notes and low notes are clear,  guitar is clear as well as the drums. Turn this speaker up and drown out the party noise!Once my friends hear this speaker my recommendation won‚Äôt be needed. It will sell itself.

I use this speaker for basically sitting outside with music on low while enjoying the yard. The sound is really good. Its crisp and clear with good base.  Now the battery lasts maybe 15 minutes.  It has all kind of Bluetooth connection issues with Siri and my Iphone. It drops and cuts out.  It has always had a problem connecting.  Its a shame cause JBL used to be a good name.  I tossed it in the trash the today.
